Pours dark brown with sufficient light brown head. Aroma of malt, caramelised malt and fresh hay. Deep, dark taste with roasted malt, honey and faint tasty liqourice, leaving with a pleasant bitterness in the aftertaste. Gets better as it warms up. Good stuff...the best I have had from La Trappe so far.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Very dark brown color, thin ivory head cover, 3 or 4 lace dots. Aroma of dark malt and dried fruit. Taste is strong carbonated malt that adds dried fruit-cake fruit and prunes in the palate, then growing significantly into a finish that is already semi-sweet, not requiring much in the way of hops. A big-bodied brew, dark and rich and a little heavy for my palate.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Mahogny färgad vätska med stort ljust skum. Söt doft utan inslag av jäst. Smarrig!
Pours a dark ruby brown color. Aroma and taste are sweet with caramel and biscuit malts.
0,33 bottle. Amber color with thin brownish head. Caramel, little alcohol in the background, biscuit aroma. Medium sweetness at the beginning, roasted malts, cookie, alcohol at the end.

Pours a dark brown with big head. Rather big nose for a double. Malty, toffee, herbs, spices, a hint of boose, funk and belgo yeast. Medium+ bodied palate, balanced and complex with medium+ finish. Superior to the Chimay Rouge I had earlier. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
30.8.2014. Sweet, slightly syrupy. Taste has caramel sweetness, some spices and yeast. Too simple and straightforward.

Bottle at home in London - sourced from Ales by Mail. Pours clear amber with a large, dense and frothy beige head. Lovely aroma, lots of candied fruits, brown bread, toffee, Belgian yeast. Medium sweet flavor with rich bready malts, caramel and toffee, ripe semi-dark fruits, dates, slight toasted grains and butterscotch. Medium bodied with average to lively carbonation. Rather nicely balanced on the finish with toasted candi sugars, understated Belgian yeast, bready malts, slight alcohol warmth, ripening fruits, caramel. An excellent example of the style. So rich yet so drinkable.
300ml Flasche. Rotbraun und leicht trüb. Kleine Schaumkrone. Sehr würziges Karamellaroma. Voller, süsslicher Geschmack.
Volle smaak, karamel en licht de hop. Redelijke schuimkop. Aroma van bloesem.
Een doorsnee dubbel bier, niet slecht maar ook niet bijzonder. Er zit een typisch smaakje aan dat ook aan het bokbier van Bavaria zit.

0,33 bottle purchased at Beerville store in Belgrade and consumed in Pozarevac-Serbia pairing a carbonade stew. Ciao Vlada. Pours filtered caramel color, ruby with a medium-high ivory cap. Nose: caramelized malts, prunes, chocolate. Mouth: a weird bitter overall palate in a general environment of roasted malts, brown sugar and a hint of caramel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark ruby with medium beige head that lasts. Awesome aroma of malts, peach, raisins, honey, spicy and fruity. Taste is fruity, sweet, reminds me caramel biscuits. Full body and awesome creamy texture.
A lovely Belgian Trappist beer. dark colour with an aroma similar to liquorise. very smooth taste.

Cerveja bem saborosa, vale a pena tomar novamente se achar em bom preço, no pão de açúcar custa R$ 50,00. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle. Dark mahogany body with a medium tan head. Dark sugars, dried fruit, yeast and caramel. Ends a bit bitter.

.33l bottle from Alko JKL 
Pours murky dark cloudy red with tan low head. Aroma is floral, caramel, nuts, dried fruits, bread and syrup. Flavor is malts, alcohol, syrup, caramel, bready, dried fruits and nuts. Nice CO2. Swell!
Aroma: roasted malts. Appearance: clear brown liquid, yellowish frothy head. Taste. Medium sweet light bitter roasted malts. Palate: light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2016 Tonaca di frate con riflessi rossi appena accennati, schiuma fine poco compatta e non troppo persistente. Aroma dolce di caramello e spezie, risplende al palato con il malto, il caramello, note speziate leggere. Carbonazione elevata, alcol in evidenza. Trappista di livello.

Copenhagen 19/2 2015. 75 cl bottle from Fakta. Pours dark reddish brown with light beige head. Slowly subsiding. Aroma of ripe fruits and clear notes of alcohol. Soft carbonation. Taste is spicy and fairly bitter. You can clearly taste the 7 % this beer is holding. Finish is kinda dry. Nice Belgian.

brown hazy color, big off-white head. smells yeasty, wheat, spices, cloves, red currant. full body, slick mouthfeel, spices, light alcoholic, astringent, red berries, some sweetness, light alcoholic frutiy spicy finish, good but bored me a bit.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2016 The best Dutch brand of beers with is widely available. ITs a nice special beer that you can get in every bar and store in The Netherlands. Its the second best trappist (havent tasted Westvleteren and the French and Austrian trappist yet). This beer seems very dark brown, but when seen with a light behind the glas the colour turns out to be ruby red. The foam layer is nice but doesnt stay long. The color of the foam is brown. The smell is nice. Its a bit malty, and sweet, like a propped Duvel. There is a little metaly touch to it. It is a strong beer with a long and pleasant finish, which doesnt get boring. The taste is good, tot to sweet, not to bitter, not sour, perfectly balanced. This beer is a recommendation, just like every La Trappe beer.

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Small tan head which fades quickly. Reddish brown clear body. Aroma is dark fruits, belgian trappist yeast, candi and sugar. Slightly spicy. Sweet on the tongue. Creamy mouthfeel.

330 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with moderate retentive head. Aromas of figs, prunes, dark candi sugar, and sweet malts. Flavors of sweet bready malts, brown sugar, dark fruit, and raisins with a faint spice and metallic notes. Creamy. An excellent Dubbel.
Low foam deep brown color. Smell of banana and red fruits. Fresh taste, very refreshing with sweet aftermatch. Fantastic Trappist. Less strong than expected, but great.

Aromat fenolowy, owocowy (dojrzałe banany). Piana szybko opada do zerowej. Barwa głęboko bursztynowa. W smaku to samo co w aromacie. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. Wysycenie wysokie, goryczka najwyżej średnia. Ogólnie ciekawy dubbel, ale nie najlepszy jakiego piłem.

Dark copper, slightly hazy. Thick foam. Aromas of dark fruits, Raisins and chocolate. Spice notes are there, but restrained and nicely intertwined. Alcohol aroma is sweet, warming and integrates beautifully.
Well balanced dubbel, malty.
0,33 liter bottle. Dark brown beer with a creamy head. Tastes of yeast, sugar, caramel, dark fruit. Good mix between different flavours and diverse enough. Great double!

Aroma van bruine suikers en een frisse zachte fruitige bries. Prachtige robijnrode kleur met redelijke carbonatie. Caramel(cremig) van smaak met een veelvoud aan fruitige smaken (banaan, toffee. Mooie ontwikkeling tussen carbonatie en caramel, sprankelend zoet. Vol (dik) van smaak met een redelijk volle body. Prachtige dubbel die mooi in balans is.

Deep red with tan head. Aroma is complex caramel, Belgian spice, red berries and some sweet licorice. Nice and full palate. Aftertaste is caramel, some chocolate, spice and some noble hops. Overall: Very nice.

Beige, rothy, rocky, fairly persistent head. Copper, fairly cloudy. Intense and fairly persistent at nose. Dark honey, candy sugar, caramel, biscuit, spruce prunes. Medium carbonation, fairly warming sensation.

Donkerbruin bier met smalle beige schuimkraag.
Karamel met een zoete toets in de neus.
Moutig en zoetig in de mond.
Lange zoete afdronk.

Presenta color ámbar oscuro con media capa de espuma beige y baja retención presentando un fino cerco final, aromas a caramelo, frutos secos, y azúcar candy; en boca entrada suave y maltosa con predominio de notas dulces y especias; cuerpo y carbónico medios con final largo y dulce, aceptable cerveza trapense.
Coloração marrom, corpo baixo, carbonatação refinada e sabor muito agradável. Vale cada centavo.

Served in a trappist glass. Brown with a medium beige head. Aroma is yeast, caramel, grapes, prunes, bananas, bread, molasses, light alcohol presence. Taste is yeast, bananas, caramel, biscuit, chocolate, wood, alcohol and raisin. Light bittersweet and sour aftertaste. Great beer!

Keg at Draft House. Dark brown, big foamy white head. Aroma is very malty, some alcohol, Belgian yeast character. Body is medium, slightly foamy, low carbonation. Taste is raisin, big malt, toffee, soft bitterness, semisweet.

330ml bottle. Pours a dark, murky copper with a creamy light brown head. Aroma is of spices, banana, caramel and yeast, with its alcohol content evident but not overwhelming. Sweet taste with a hint of bitterness. Smooth body and adequate carbonation; overall an extremely well-made, enjoyable beer.
Light hazy brown body with a large light brown head. Aroma of caramel, banana, brown sugar, The taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter. Sticky texture.

Cupper dark red beer with a nice beige head, medium carbonation.
Taste is caramel and fruity Belgian yeast.
Afthertaste is sweet.

Bottle @ home shared with @Meilby. Thanks!
-
Poured a clear brown/reddish tint with a light brown fair head. Smells and tastes of licorice and malt. Smooth a only slightly bitter. Good!
ottima birra, di un bel colore rosso scuro, schiuma rossastra non troppo persistente. rimane in bocca abbastanza a lungo.
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2016 Dark cloudy red copper, beautiful. Beige head. Nice carbonation, fruity malt. Long finish. Burnt caramel, toffee, superb taste and aroma. Sweet.

Bottle 0.33l at Samo Pivo Belgrade Serbia with ippopotamo36. Pour it dark reddish color with medium white head.On the nose yeast.Taste and aroma of dark fruits,caramel, good spices and Belgian yeast.Perfect dubbel.

Slightly boozy, jam, dried fruits, yeasty, herbal, straw.
Hazy ruby colour, medium beige head.
Heavy cloying sweetness, soft bite, yeasty, ABV evident. 
Medium body, lively carbonation, sweet finish.
Ok.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka. Barwa brazowawa, bez wiekszych rubinowych przeblyskow ktore sie czesto w dubblach pojawiaja, piana ladna ale szybko redukujaca sie, kremowa, malo zostajaca na szkle. Aromaty typowe - slodowe, owoce (sliwki, wisnie, banan, daktyle), karmel. W smaku dosc podobnie, slodowo, owocowo (lekko nawet kwaskowate te owoce, chyba najbardziej wisnie i sliwki), karmelowo, rodzynki, bez goryczki specjalnej, troche przyprawowo, troche posmakow hmmmm ciastek, troche alkoholu. Dosc duze wysycenie. Orzezwiajacy. Gladki w ustach. dobry.update z 7.03.2015 - z kega w piwapaw - wydaje sie bardziej owocowe. bardzo intensywne. robi wrazenie, widac, ze to klasa.zmiany po slepym tescie dubbli - szczegoly tiny.pl/gwtlqOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Pours light ruby with an off white head. Aromas of caramel, rye bread, raisins, plums, toffee. Taste is caramel, rye bread, raisins, plums and toffee. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Dunkel-braunes Dubbel mit einem leicht dunklen Schaum. Aroma: Citrus, Likör, Hasel. Geschmack: Vollmundig, cremig mit tollen Röstaromen, Citrus, Nuss, bittersüß.

0,33 l botttle. Pours out in a darkest brown, one finger foamy head. Fresh hopy fruity in a belgian style on the nose. Starts with a lot of malt, lower fruit and sweetness as expected. Little bit yeast. Smooth, herb chewing gum. Light alcoholic, spicy malt. Mid bitter ending. Yes!
Pours clear brown with tall light brown/off-white head. Aroma of bread, hazel nut, citrus, malts. Taste is sweet, rye bread and nuts. Body is light to medium with soft carbonation.
330ml bottle. Pours dark with creamy white head. Sweet yeasty aromas. Sweet, slightly fruity taste. Bubblegum hints. Very good
caramel, dough, cloudy, brown, medium sweetness, medium body, overall its a very good beer
oK beer but nothing special in my opinion, sure more body than the double and better overall
Bottle from Smatch, Brussels, Belgium. Belgian Style Dubbel. This beer won Gold Award from European Beer Star in 2014 under Belgian Style Dubbel Category.

DAA; Bottle 33 cl. Pours large, dark brown with a large frothy to creamy, fading, still lacing, tan head. Nose is heavy malt, caramel, yeast, dark fruit, ripe fruit, alchol and spice. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, light to moderate bitter with a lasting warming, spice finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft to avarage. Smooth, alcoholic, complex and enjoyable.

Dark reddish brown colour, hazy, beige nicely lacing creamy head. Dried fruits like figs and raisins, cherries, gingerbread, coffee and chocolate, liquorice, sweet and slightly roasted malty caramel and toffee. Lingering sweet, fruity aftertaste. High carbonation, but still a soft mouthfeel, good body.

Pours dark brown/red with a large beige head.
Pleasant aroma with notes of raisins, spices and maybe some licorice.
Strong complex malt flavours of burnt toffee, caramel and some dry fruit.
Good hop balance with a nice dry finish. 
Medium body - High carbonation makes it very quaffable despite the relatively high ABV.

Nice double. Dark red with an off white head and lively prickly carbonation. It is quite fresh and not as sweet as others I had in the style. It is even a bit light bodied and dry in comparison. Flavor has a nice balance with yeast burned malts and caramel. Very easy to drink. A beer with caracter.

33cl bottle. It is one iconic beer (or ale). It has huge beige foam with nice taste alone, but beer is much better. Caramel and coffee the first after some sweet malt, and hop at the end. Creamy, silky. There are massive alcohol in the beer, but its not disturbing, rather heavy bodied. Price is also heavy.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 25cl van het vat bij De Dikke Dragonder, Maastricht Alcoholpercentage van 7% Uitgeschonken in origineel La Trappe glas Uiterlijk: koperbruin met schuimkraag die snel wegtrekt Aroma en smaak: ijzertje, caramel, lichte fruitig als banaan, gebrande mout Conclusie: enige trappist van eigen bodem, de dubbel is niet verkeerd, maar geen hele volle smaken
Nice roasted malt and sweet fruit aroma. Robust flavor, cherries, honey and roasted malts. Yeasty and pleasant carbonation. Excellent

Colour: copper-brown, with a beige head.
Nose: dark (forest) fruits - apricot, plum. Hints of chocolate and raisins. Slight hoppiness.
Flavours: chocolate malt returns. licorice, cough drop. Hints of caramel and spices.
Finish: long, mellow, warming.
Verdict: good Trappist dubbel, but not quite the finest out there.
330ml bottle from BePLUS, Xiamen. Pours hazy dark brown with a dissipating white head. Fruity, yeasty, malty aroma. Sweet finish.

Rica cerveza belga (en esta ocasión bien tirada de barril), sabor intenso y acaramelado, bonito color ámbar y espuma espesa y duradera dejando un marcado encaje de Bruselas en la copa.... retrogusto prolongado en paladar y equilibrado alcohol.

Butelka 750 ml z data do 05-2014, wiec ok 6 msc po terminie. Kolor ciemnobrunatny, lekko zmetnione. Nalalo sie z lekko brunatna, bardzo obfita piana, ledwie zdazylem nalac zanim wylecialo z butelki. W aromacie dominuja czeresnie i pestki od czeresni, dalej karmel i inne owoce, ogolnie aromat malo intensywny, ale przyjemny. W odczuciu polwytrawne, idealnie gladkie, srednio wysycone, tak jak byc powinno. W smaku ponownie dominuje owocowosc polaczona z migdalami, dalej lekka cierpkosc i karmelowa slodycz oraz minimalny sciagajacy alkohol. Goryczki prawie nie ma, jedynie lekkie alkoholowo-lodygowe odczucie w ustach.

Bottle 33 cl.
Clear brown, off-white head. Aroma of sweet caramel, malt, and some yeast. Medium sweet and bitter, slightly sour.

La Trappe Dubbel est une bière trappiste brassée par la brasserie Koningshoeven aux Pays-Bas. C'est une bière moyennement corsée qui est filtrée puis mise en bouteille avec de la levure et du sucre.
Elle offre en dégustation des arômes étonnants de bonbon, de figuier, de raisin sec et d'épices sous un goût sucré, caramélisé et de malt foncé. Elle se présente dans une robe chaleureuse aux couleurs rouge/rubis sous une tête blanche,
véritable bière trappiste foncée avec une saveur douce, crémeuse et un bouquet prononcé.

Piana średnia, dynamicznie rosnąca i tak samo szybko opadająca, w stylu szampana. Barwa brązowa, lekko opalizująca. Aromat zadziwiająco słodki, rodzynkowy, daktylowy, kandyzowanych owoców, suszonej żurawiny i karmelu. W smaku słodycz wyłącznie owocowa, fruktozowa, niewielka przyprawowa goryczka, w połączeniu z dość wysokim, szampanowym nagazowaniem, fajnie podwyższają pijalność i balans piwa. Po ogrzaniu słodkość jeszcze bardziej wypiera herbaciano-chmielowa goryczka a w aromacie pojawiają się nutki biszkoptowe.
smells vinegar, yeast and wheaty, mahogany colour with a creamy white head. quite sour with full bodied fruity dry finish, really good
Ok, everything as expected from dubbel. Good ethanol, to start with. Thou Chimay red is bit better :)

Dark amber colour with a big beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, yeast, a bit dusty. Taste is sweet, fruity, with a light bitterness. A bit of spice. Medium body, mild smooth carbonation, dry finish. Nice easy dubbel.
My favourite beer. Nice soft, sweet brown beer with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Perfect with traditional food, or on a rainy autumn afternoon.
Una dubbel caratterizzata dal corpo molto strutturato, con gradevoli note di caramello e di biscotto, profumi floreali, con schiuma normale. Abbastanza alcolica ma nello stile

@ Havregatan 141108. Bottle (750 ml) from Kvickly, Helsingør (41 DKK). Malty and fruity with yeasty and spicy notes, light caramely with dried fruits, maybe some smokey notes as well, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is light bitter and malty.
Fantastico bouquet. Sapore intenso anche troppo in certi frangenti. Ottimo retrogusto con secondari di ottimo livello.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 Bought in the local supermarket. Pours clear and dark brown with a quick disappearing off-white head. All thats left, is some lacing. Aroma of sugars, bit of fruits, toffee, yeast, bit flowerish... Nice. Taste is sweet. Bit of a banana kick, caramel, yeast. Lovely. Finish is sweet as well. Slight alcoholic kick and a late hint of the hops with a very soft bitter end. Yet, it is sweet all over the line. It never gets too sweet though. In the very end there is a little dry kick as well. Very good. Beautiful balance. Medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel and quite a lively carbonation. Overall seen, a beautifully balanced sweet dubbel that works out just fine on the colder days. Easy to find and very good beer. Thats how we want it.
From the most ratings list. Lots of candy sugar and fruit sweetness. Chewy grain with a bit of cherry and plum. Nutty grain with a touch of Belgian yeast. Complex and entertaining.

Aroma: Rich, malt, bread crusts, syrup, buttery. Fruity, plum, banana. Light spicy
Appearance: body: hazy amber. Head: small, light brown, lacing.
Flavour: malt: rich, bready, light buttery. Light alcolic sting. Fruity, light banana, peach. Yeast: medium peppery. Dry finish, lingering malt & fruitiness.
Mouthfeel: medium warming, medium-light body, medium-high carbonation.
Overall: Good example.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre.
18B Belgian Dubbel
330 bottle. Aromaty przyjemne belgijskie, lekki alkohol, bananowe, goździkowe. Mało wysycone.
Klasa belgijska. Zapach miąższu bananowego, bardzo przyjemny. Smak typowo belgijski, złożony, ciekawy.

Instable head, rich aroma; Fresh, sweet aroma of soft fruit, like bananas and lychees. Lovely little bit of bitterness in the back of your mouth, with again those bananas and lychees comig in front.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 18B). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 20:05 K27B14. AROMA: sweet caramel base aroma with alcohol spicy notes. APPEARANCE: dark amber color and a bit hazy. average and moussy tanned head with average retention. TASTE: sweet and caramely flavour profile. some spicy notes. medium-low bitterness that lingers into a medium-dry finish. PALATE: medium body with medium-high carbonation. OVERALL: an average trapist dubbel that would benefit from more malt complexity.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
A: Pours a beautiful dark amber color with a huge bubbled aired beige head. Low retention. Not much lacings left
S: Fruity (Raisins mainly). Caramel, caramel malts and yeasts. Quite biscuity and bit hoppy end
T: Follows the nose. Mild sweet and molasses upfront. Caramel, raisins, caramel malts, yeasts. It finishes with a mild hoppy bitterness
M: Medium body and carbonation. Sweet upfront. A bit molasses sensation. Mild bitter end
O: Good beer.
[ BA Review @ 7/12/2011 ]
Mooi donker bier met een mooie schuimlaag erop. Bier ruikt zeer fruitig. Mooie smaak ook van fruit.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color. Aromas are plums and pear syrup (poiret/peren stroop), hint of chocolate. Very nice fruitiness that suits the winter time. Slight booziness. Taste is relatively flat compared to the aroma. Mostly caramel notes mixed with raw cocoa. Very light creaminess. Burnt sugar and rye in the aftertaste.
On tap. Deep brownish amber body, beige head. Aroma of toast, caramel and some chocolate maybe. Taste of toast, caramel, medicinal hops, fruits and some chocolate. Nice beer for sure.

Big banana effervescence with caramel malts followed by a long hoppy finish.

Rated by BrewTom
Bottle. Pour is dark, aroma is fruity, toffee, alcohol and sweetness. Taste is fruity, alcohol, sweet, texture is creamy, body is medium, carbonation is gentle. Nice
Piwo bardzo treściwe. Pozostawiające po sobie posmak słodowo/drożdżowy z wyraźnie słodkimi nutami owocowymi.
Keg at Cafe Belgique. Pours brown, smooth, roasted, burnt liquorice, raisins.
Brown with nicely yellow medium head. Flower / fruit aroma. Sweet, bit acid taste with flower notes, quite strong but mild bitter aftertaste.

Pours deep brown with reasonable tan head. Aroma is sweet golden syrup, dates, raisins and plums. Mouthfeel is full. This beer is full of flavour for a dubbel. Very good example of the style

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice and dark full bodied beer with sweet Aromas of caramel and dark fruit. Typical belgian.
Bottle at home. A complex beer with tastes of caramel, toffee & dark fruits. Medium to full body. Highly enjoyable.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color ambar oscuro. Sabor a malta, alcohol, dulce, ligeramente a uvas pasas.
At the habit in York. Dark beer by my standards but quite fruity and smooth. Very nice

Have had this since the 80s, but never before in my RB life. 33 cl bottle shared, young. Nice dark red-brown color. Creamy light beige head with a layer of a few mm retention. Aromas: sweet, red fruit, peardrops. Flavor is moderate sweet, dark malts. Medium bodied. Not much of a finish. Decent but rather boring. I wonder whether it this tasted the same 20/25 years ago, I think it changed quite a bit.
Bottle 750ml. Clear dark amber with low beige head. Aroma of cherry, liqueur, red wine notes. Flavor of cherry, raisins, malty, alcoholic. Medium carbonation. Medium body.

The classic double La Trappe, with light beige, crackling head which collapses quite quickly and is almost completely gone in the end. Colour is a very dark burgundy with a certain orange hue, hazy after adding the deposit. Subtle but quite pleasant aroma of overripe plums, raisins, dried banana, brownies, toasted bread, iron, cloves, citrus peel, candi sugar, brown rhum. Taste starts sweetish, some candi sugar, candied fruits, pear, with medium strong, mineral-like and sourish carbonation, quite tingling on the sides of the tongue, otherwise slick and smooth mouthfeel, caramelly maltiness with nutty touches here and there, a bit chocolatey even but in a subtle way, some iron, finishing with slight toasted bitterness, some residual sweetness from the onset but not cloyingly so, leafy hop bitterishness and just a little bit of warming, gin-like alcohol, subtle and not disturbing in any way; also a somewhat dull sourishness lingering on, quite long. Sweetish to dryish in other words, but all -ish, if you see what I mean... A bit too restrained for my taste, but admittedly this is a well-made dubbel. Id recommend this to anyone looking for a typical example of the style in order to get acquainted with it.  Still, the La Trappe range cannot convince me like the Belgian trappist ales do, they just do not have the same amount of distinctiveness and personality, at least since Bavaria took over.

330ml bottle from Vanuxeem. Pours deep amber with off white head. Good aroma of warming stewed fruits. Taste is a big flavoursome dubbel with dark fruits, malts, bubblegum and caramel. Rich, smooth and delicious. One of the best dubbels out there in my opinion.

Bottiglia da 0,33. Birra eccezionale. Schiuma corposa e persistente. Colore ambrato. Carbonatura equilibrata. Aroma deciso e piacevolmente affumicato. Sentori di legno. Gusto fruttato pieno e duraturo. Finale caramellato. Peccato sia già finita! Consiglio 10/10
Easy to drink, yet flavorful and complex ale. Very sour taste that I personally like.
Spezifarbenes Dubbel. Hefig, karamellig, bananig, dunkle Früchte in der Nase. Süßlich, hefig, karamellig, malzig am Gaumen. Auskleidend im Mund, gut.
herbs, brown, red, hazy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, lively, carbonation,

Bottle. Pours a beautiful, mostly clear mahogany brown, ruby hue, with a big tan orange-ish head, good lacing. Aroma is very fruity, dried plums, dates, raw cane sugar, sweet caramel. Grenadine syrup pops up too. Artificial sweeteners (Assugrin) in the after taste. The taste is very smooth, contained sweetness, with just a little bit of acidity to balance. Medium bodied, oily palate with just a bit too much carbonation but a very long sweet, syrupy finish that turns into artificial sweetener, extra long. Really, really long. Definitely one of the longest finishes Ive had. Very nice, not cloying like most Dubbels, but too much artificial sweeteners in the after taste, especially since it is so long.
Bottle. Amder-brown with a creamy off-white head. The aroma is fruity, caramel malt, some yeast. The flavour is sweet with a fruity profile, again a little yeast. Not the greatest dubbel.

Bottle (at Rocket Burger); pours brown with a thin khaki head; yeast aroma with dark fruit and alcohol; sweet taste with malt, caramel, dark fruits, some spices; dry finish with a hint of alcohol; nice one
La trappe dubbel is een behoorlijk stevig bier. Het heeft een lekker vol mondgevoel maar is wel erg zoet.
La Trappe Dubbel is een mooi vol biertje, heeft een goede smaak, maar wel lichtelijk zoet
Een deftig donker bier met goed wat smaak aan zoals het hoort te zijn. Ze hebben wel betere dan dit in hun assortiment.
Very dark red, strong beige head. Sour yeasty notes on the nose. Sweet-ish with noticeable bitterness, same on finish. Fades rather fast.
330ml ml bottle, pours deep red, aroma bready malt, dark fruit, blackcurrant jam, nicely balanced bitter finish. Medium body, thin texture, lively carb. Solid dubbel.

Bottle. Pours a semi cloudy dark brown with red hues. Slightly off white thick head. Aromas of yeast, caramel malt, raisins, booze and dark dried fruit. Taste is slightly alcoholic, pretty high carbonation, caramel, chocolate, dark sweet fruits.
Ottima birra dubbel. Perfetta nel suo stile. Aromi di banana, vaniglia e caramello al naso. In bocca ben bilanciata, alcoolica e carbonata a dovere. Retrogusto infinito.
Cerveja trapista de coloração ambar, muito reconfortante em noites frias, com um sabor caramelizado e suave doçura. Colarinho persistente de leve coloração ambar. A repetir.

Great copper reddish color with considerable head. Heavy sweet Belgian double aroma and the taste is in the same line. The palate on the other hand is soft and nice. Overall an average Trappist double, nothing exceptional.

330ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Looks: Deep amber brown colour with thin trace of dirt- like yeast sediments; Three-quarter finger head and crumpety light-beige foam which lasts for 1 minute; Excellent sticky lacing with small fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Sweet dark malt with very fragrant banana (wow!), strong vanilla, creamed cake, caramel, light pineapple, sugar, bubblegum, strong Bel yeast and faint grassy hops.

Taste: Mid to light sweet amber malt, with banana, caramel, creamed light waffles, strong ester, light spices, very light alcohol, molasses, strong Bel yeast, light lemon and lime, very light bitter hops and faint grass. 

Body: Mid to full; Slick, smooth and slightly creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Moderate amber malt, but the Bel yeast / esters work wonders - tasty banana, cream cake, caramel, vanilla and spices, just-right molasses, smooth as silk. It hits you at the right spot at the right time. Beautiful! 

Hoppiness: Faint grass nose, light lemony lime and grass in taste. Bitterness is typically low, match well with low sweetness for a neat low sweet-bitter finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry. Very easy and smooth to mouth.

Comments: I think La Trappe has a winner with this Dubbel: Its taste may not be as colourful as Chimay Red or as hoppy as Westmalle Dubbel, but its smooth taste, outstanding banana and cake-like esters in aroma and taste makes it very fulfilling and enjoyable. One of the top dogs, highly recommended!

pours a nice chestnut color with about an average foamy head. The head itself is rather dense just not very tall. Nicely carbonated.
Foam fades but the carbonation always keeps a wispy ring floating on top.
I get a rich malt aroma topped by candied sugar.
Rich and malty tasting with candied sugar yeast and fruity essence, maybe candied plumes. Alcohol taste is bold and in your face. Luckily the ABVs are at a more moderate level for this light weight.
A medium to full bodied beer with a drier finish.

Cloudish deep red color, average sized head with low retention and small lacing. Full body, soft carbonation. Very yeasty, malts, spices, raisins, overripe fruits, hints of alcohol. Medium to high sweetness. OK Dubbel, but not really my cup of tea.

Bottle - pours ruby red with a fizzy light brown head which quickly fades to a ring. Aroma of light roasted malt, chocolate, cloves and some hints of banana. Taste is spicy, light roasted malt, cocoa, cloves with some hints of liquorice. Medium sweetness, medium body and high carbonation.

330ml Bottle from The House Of Trembling Madness (York):
Sweet & complex with some dark & ripe fruits featuring plum, dates & cherries with a little raisin & sugar. Rich with some caramel malts & touches of hops too.

Mahogany brown with a 0.5cm head thats a fine & bubbly bordering on creamy. Retention is okay but the head slowly reduces in size over the first couple of minutes, leaving a fine lacing across the surface.

Quite sweet with ripe, dark fruits; the plum & dates are here again. Rich with some spice coming through & nice malts plus good hops too. Some caramel & grapes round things off with a faint hint of alcohol as well.

Light medium in body with lively carbonation& a sweet feel that has spicy areas & a dry, smooth finish that almost seems creamy & goes down well.

Great stuff from La Trappe, a very sweet beer that was balanced out with some good spice & touches of malts which prevented the beer from seeming sickeningly sweet. A very good offering and one Id pick up again.
An underappreciated Dutch trappist. Complex, a little nuttiness to add to the dark fruit, molasses, and brown sugar.

Bottle from old backlog notes 07. Pours a hazy reddish brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet caramel, brown suga, raisins, stone fruit, yeast, some sspices, better than the Blonde.

Bottle. Pours amber, bit hazy, to finger nut brown head. Aroma is a lot of belgian yeast, ripe fruit, banana, caramel. Taste is sweet, but too light body. And bit bald finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dubbel veramente molto buona. Il fruttato e il maltato le fanno da padrona, ma è chiaramente percepibile un buon floreale, che la rende una birra molto versatile negli abbinamenti culinari.

750 ml bottle. Pours dark amber with tall, long-lasting, foamy off-white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of bready malt, caramel, ripe cherries, apples and yeast. Body is full, creamy and spicy. Spicy yeast, caramel malt, bread crust, plums, raisins, brown sugar fill the mouth. Finish is long, spicy, semi-sweet. Extremely delicious brew.

Pörkölt illatok kezdik meg a bemutatkozást, majd az első kortyok selymesen tárják fel az utat az ízlelés terepén. Amint hőfoka a szoba hőmérsékletéhez alkalmazkodni kezd, az ízek egyre jobban kibontakoznak, melyek a kávés, pörkölt karakter mellett a bor aromáját is felmutatják. Miközben lecsendesedik, az íze is egyre összeszedettebbé válik, és a kellemes, pörkölt malátás jegyeké lesz a főszerep.

12.06.2014, 0,75l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry fruity, caramel malts, yeast, hay, dried dark fruits, bubblegum, almonds, nuts, chocolate. Taste is slightly dry and harsh, caramel malts, hay, yeast, alcohol, grass, dried dark fruits, almond essence. Medium bitterness, slightly dry harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2014 Bottle, 75cl. Pours a deep ruby colour with a modest, frothy light brown head. Aroma is of banana, clove, sweet malts, dry fruits and alcohol. Light to medium body with medium to high carbonation. Perhaps just a touch watery. Sweet and some bitterness towards the end. Very drinkable.

Bottle 750ml. A clear ruby red beer with a frothy head that fades away after a minute. Aroma is faint and I can´t distinguish anything. This beer has heavy carbonation and taste is bitter with a medium to strong alcohol finish. Beautiful appearance, good flavor and disappointing aroma.

Pours a clear brown with a brown-white head. Dust malt aroma Tastes include alcohol, toffee and hints of nutmeg. Finishes with roasted malt and herby yeast bitterness. Slightly cloying sugar in back of the throat at the end. Not much malt sweetness. Medium-full body with fairly sharp carbonation. Overall, on the herbier side for dubbels, and not my favorite.

Clean dark brown color, clean with long-lasting creamy foam.
Vanilla and toasted cereals and malts on the aroma.
Roasted cereals and malts on the taste, also some fruits, bittersweet ending.

Bottle. Dark brown, with a foamy beige head, looks nice. Aromas of toffee and dried berries. Taste is light sweet, decent bitter, noticeable alcohol. Good carbonation, overwhelming finish, has spices, roasty maltiness and something bready that lingers around for a while. 

Every sip is something to enjoy, great beer, has quite a few aromas to discover.
Op de tap bij "de bank" te helmond. Donkere kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie: caramel, chocola.

Bouteille de 330 ml (6.5% ABV).  Dégustée le 27 août 2004. Bière brune trouble. Mousse assez, col épais et durable. Assez effervescente, bulles moyennes. Odeur de caramel, de sirop dérable, de sucre grillé. Très douce, assez sucrée, assez amère en finale. Très bonne dans lensemble. Par contre, manque un peu de caractère, un peu légère.

Dark cinnamon coloured pour with a lofty ample head. Smells of decaying berries and raisins, earth and wood. Tastes the same but with toffee and toasted malts. This ol fellah couldnt be drinking these everyday, musky leather sweetness with potent alcohol flavour. Pretty fun to try it.
bottle at home, dark red/brown beer with a medium/small head, aroma is malts, taste is sweet and malts, not bad but not great

Not as intense as I expect from dubbel, but quite drinkable. Starts bit too thin, but afterwards goes down with some performance. Nice maltiness, caramel, candy, dried fruits, raisins, spicy. Mostly sweet with moderate to light bitterness. Decent, bit too carbonated
This beer has a very nice hazelnut color with a sweet bready aroma , with banana ,bubblegum , the flavor is smooth and silky .
Deep reddish brown with full mocca colored head. Light fruit, yeast, caramel and light roasted touch. Quite sweet with cardboard bitterness. Medium bodied with light dry finish. Ok

Very dark red-brown color, medium initial beige head that rapidly dissipates.
Aroma is fruity and dry fruits. Taste has notes of caramel, dried fruit like plum . very malty and yeast. Aftertaste is long, sweet and slightly bitterness.

Bottle. Pours brown with an off white head. Aroma: Caramel, earthy, dark fruit, slightly floral. Taste: banana, cane sugar, bread, raisins, dried fruits (apricots, prunes). Smooth, not particularly sweet or bitter, medium bodied, fairly short finish. Nice brew, lacks a bit of depth.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 Pours hazy brown with a cloudy head which didnt last for long. Aroma of taffy. Palate of chocolate and banana

Cervesa amb un bon cos i aroma, sobretot a caramel i fruita vermella.
Cerveza con un buen cuerpo y aroma, sobretodo a caramelo y a frutos rojos.
Really good, well balanced trappist, my bottle has also aged very nicely. Smooth and quite easy, still really enjoyable.
Bottle @ Convent Santa Clara, Middelburg. Dark brown with beige foam. Sweet and fruity character with notes of caramel and dark fruit. Rather sweet with light bitter finish.
Caramel, brood, hooi, graan, chocolade, koffie, hooi, bloemig, toast, geroosterd, hars, noten

Sampled from bottle @ Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Pretty standard abbey dubbel: dark brown colour, decent head, smell and taste malts, some caramel and sweetness. Average to medium body and carbonation. Nice trappist brew.

[Bottle] Brown pour is nearly clear. Only a small amount of white head. Yeasty nose mixes with sweet rolls and dough. Sweet caramel and biscuit taste. Fainter notes of clove and light brown sugar. A classic beer.
Dark amber tan head aroma sweet candy, raisins and toast. Taste is malty with a fruity finish. Medium slick palate medium co2

Bottle conditioned BB 4/2016. Thin tan head with no retention. Rich mahogany body. Nose is Belgian yeast, vinous fruit, hops, oak, alcohol, nail varnish, crystal malt, banana, clove, cherries, bubblegum, spice, some blue cheese. Bittersweet. Some almost lactic notes. Dry finish. Fizzy mouthfeel. Warming.
Golden brown color with red notes, quickly disappearing light brown head. Dried fruit, plums and candi sugar nose. Bread and yeast taste, earthy, malty. Medium to full body, soft carbonation.
Ez a Belga apátsági sör, nagyon jó. Egy kocsit keserédes, utóize hosszan tart. Szép a szine.

Cerveza trapense holandesa. Color marrón oscuro con capa de espuma muy ligera beige. Olor bastante afrutado. Sabor malteado a caramelo y regusto a frutos rojos. Amargor suave al principio dejándose notar al final.

Aroma of candy and malt. The texture is balanced with some sweet malt and a little hops to cut the sweetness. The taste is similarly balanced with some nice spice notes mixed in with a good malt backbone.
Sweet aroma, very dark brown, medium head, smoooth finish; not as sickenly sweet as most Belgian beers. Probably one of my favorite belgian beers I have tasted. - March Madness 2014

Buona - ma non eccezionale - birra questa dubbel prodotta dalla brasseria La Trappe. Birra che si presenta con un bellaroma. Al naso arrivano note di caramello, uva passa, e caffè, ma non troppo forti e non troppo distinte. Laspetto è bello ma non bellissimo. Birra rosso ambrata opalescente, non impenetrabile, con una bella e spugnosa schiuma color nocciola. Alla lingua il sapore risulta dolciastro con un minimo di acidità. In bocca, la birra ha una carbonatazione media, non eccessiva. La birra è tendente al frizzante, quindi, con un corpo tra il medio e lo scialbo ed una consistenza abbastanza lieve. Il finale è astringente ed amarognolo, con il sapore di prugne, caramello e caffè che si avvertono ma non troppo. Come detto una buona birra, non eccelsa, ma che si beve con piacere e facilità.
Très bonne bière de dégustation, intense et corpulente juste ce quil faut. Arômes boisés bien équilibrés puis finale assez sèche et une pointe damertume.
Bela cerveja escura, café chocolate malte tostado bem evidente... Mãos fraca das Lá trappe mas não deixa a desejar no estilo...
33 cl systembolaget. Mörkbrun klar färg. Doftar bröd. Smakar caramel, alkohol och vanilj. Mycket god öl!
0,33l. Wow, that is something amazing, not very familiar with the style though. Dark bread in aroma and almost sweet stuff on ur tongue.
330ml bottle. Golden-brownish color white, quickly disappearing head. Sweet malt aroma, sweet malt, banana flavor. Nice beer.

When compared to Quad - this is a watery drink, that taste of iron and cork. Nothing special. 7 ABV is well hidden, and the pour is beautiful dark chestnut with creamy head. As a reminder - go for some different dubbel if you can. This one is good, but there are better ones, IMHO.

0,33L bottle, BB 08.2015. Pours dark ruby with off white head. The head stays. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, raisins, and dark plum. Taste is very sweet, dark fruits, caramel, malt, and creamy. Finish has candy sweetness and bitterness. Overall: nice one.

Pours brown with an off-white head. Aroma is raisin and Belgian yeast with some sugary malts. Taste is slightly sweet from the raisin and other dark fruity flavors Sweet aftertaste lingers for a little while longer. Pretty good and easy to drink for a dubbel.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2016 Drank in Malden while watching Hustle. Good beer. Fresh. Caramelly taste. Salmanak. Nice warm. Typical copper beer.

Edit: Drank 02-05-16 with Dave and Syan (thanks for sharing!). Rated lower, not that rich, taste is a bit neutral.

Bière brune à la robe rubis et au col crémeux moyen. Voilà un produit de dégustation par excellence par la simplicité de ses produits naturels. Au nez: fortes effluves de caramel salé, de boisé, amertume dicrètissime. En bouche, les saveurs de caramel envahissent le palais donnant à la gorgée beaucoup de douceur mais qui sestompe assez vite. Donc, une rondeur légère, renforcée par une eau fort douce aux accents calcaires. Le boisé arrive ensuite, en rétro-nasale je dirais, rendant le palais sec et la langue aigre/douce accompagné de cette levure aux saveurs épicées légères de fruits des bois (mûre, myrtille, fraise?) . Lamertume vraiment très fine et discrète arrive toute fin. Le tout fort moelleux sans prise de tête offre une bière au caractère vif qui a de la cuisse. Sympa.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach getrockneten Früchten, Hefe, Karamell.
Geschmack hefig, Karamell, Früchte, leicht gewürzig.

75 cl/750 ml, flaske, 7,0 % ABV, købt i Kvickly på Nørrebrogade på Nørrebro, 4. marts 2014.
Ufiltreret mahogni-farvet belgisk Dubbel med flot 3 cm tyk offwhite skumtop. 
En meget sødlig og let syrlig duft breder sig i hele stuen. Duft af engelsk plumcake med masser af tørret frugt, let citrus og belgisk gær. Alkoholen kommer frem efter iltning og kan næsten beruse næsen.
Smagen er rund og fyldig af sødme, men med bitterhed som et underliggende tæppe. Smagsbilledet slutter let bittert. Godt samspil mellem smagselementerne. 
Der er massedrab kulsyre i glasset, og det kunne være mindre IMO. 
Men Dubbel'en er udmærket og forholdsvis let drikkelig uden at være for tung.
Bottle. Quite a looker, beautiful dark red color. Taste is very sweet and sugary. All in all a decent dubbel.
Bottle 30cl. Brown with a nice beige head. Typical banana aroma from the yeast. Well carbonized. Sweet taste with a little staranis hint. Not spetacular but a nice beer to drink. Medium finish.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, alcohol, green apple
Appearance-ruby, clear, tan foam
Taste-heavily sour, lightly bitter, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, lively, 
Overall-very good
Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une couleur brune caramel et une bonne mousse, en bouche il y a une grosse attaque sur le sucre candy puis sur le côté malté caramel et une pointe de banane pour terminer.

Deep red color, brown at the eye, with a big beige head, slowly disappearing. Smell is sweet, malt, licorice and sure ripe fruits.
Taste is also sweet, very ripe fruits, cane sugar, with wood notes too. 
Sweet aftertaste, lingering. 
Good beer.

Keg. Pours a very dark brown, with a persisting off-white head. Aromas of sugar, lots of dark fruit, plums and raisin. Taste- dark maltiness, bit of rich spice, raisin, plum and dark cherry hints, some sugary sweetness, malted bread, medium bodied. Very nice.

330ml bottle, poured into a La Trappe Trappist glass. Appearance is clear dark ruby-red with a medium sized tan head, that reduced quickly without leaving any lacing. Aroma of caramel, dried apricots and raisins. Flavours of caramel, toffee, dried apricots, raisins, spices and a hint of banana. Taste is light sweet and light medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Overall a good Abbey Dubbel from De Koningshoeven, but compared to other Trappist breweries its not as tasty as Westmalle Dubbel or Chimay Red.
From a bottle at home. Slightly sweet with another kind of sweet ending. Looks nice.
Dark malts, some burnt caramel, grain, and subtle hops in the aroma. The taste is on the dull side, less sweet or even bitter than I would have imagined, with a mineraly finish with some acidity.
33cl bottle @home. Pours brown with a beige head thats gone very fast. Nice aroma, bit of coffee smell and taste. Some bitterness, not that much aftertaste. Not really what I expected.
Chestnut brown with cream-coloured head. Aroma à bit cheesy. Taste of coffee and dark chocolate. Slightly Sweet.

Las belgas no son mi estilo, pero debo decir que ésta es de lo mejor que tomé hasta ahora. Aroma intenso a malta, color de una red ale, oscurita, espuma blanca alta y duradera, dulzona con presencia alcohólica, con poco de sabor a un condimento que no pudimos descubrir, pero que me pareció el punto bajo. De paladar bueno, con amargor médio/alto y durador. Para terminar, se deja tomar muy bien. Vale la pena. Precio alto para la botella de 750ml.

Clear brown pour with a offwhite big head, that quickly fizzles away. Aroma is caramel, herbs, basement aromas, earthy and bubblegum, Taste is medium sweet and pretty light in bitterness. Silky smooth mouthfeel, and good carbonation.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A brown mahogany beer with a large light beige head which disappears quite fast. Bubble carpet resisting though. Acid fruity aroma, caramel, liquorice. Medium sweetness. Light bitterness. Medium body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Sweet finish. Overall, a good dubbel. Nice bouquet and flavor.

Bottle. Brown with basically no head. Aroma has yeast, sour bread and orange. 

Taste has yeast, nut, little banana, butter, cocoa and bread. Bit too rounded and simple, but very smooth on the palate.

Kolor ciemnego bursztynu. Piana jasnobeżowa, dość obfita, drobno pęcherzykowa, szybko opada. W aromacie słodycz i owoce. W smaku toffe, karmel i alkohol. Alkoholo i słodycz odpowiednio zbalansowane. Wysycenie średnie. Bardzo przyjemne piwo.
Pour is a very dark brown with a white lacing. Strong malt and spiced aroma. Taste is with alcohol and a bit of spice.
Mooi uiterlijk, romige schuimkraag. Aangenaam aroma en heerlijke smaak vergelijkbaar met de grotere trappisten.

Butelka 0.3L. Brunatne, opalizujące z beżową, obfitą pianą, raczej drobnopęcherzykową, która szybko opada ale bardzo łatwo odbudowuje się z każdym ruchem szkła.
Pachnie suszonymi owocami, toffee, alkohol i sporo aromatów owocowo-przyprawowych typowych dla drożdży belgijskich.
W smaku podobnie ale w pierwszych łykach wyczuwalna metaliczność chmieli. Piwo wysokowysycone - musujące.
Ciało niskie do średniego. Na finiszu wytrawne z lekka goryczką chmielowo alkoholową.
Dobre piwo, bardzo ładnie pachnie. Z La Trappe wolę jednak tripla czy kwadrupla.

Big bottle with cork. Bought this one with a colleague @ AleHouse Riga. Lovely Belgian yeast flavor with sweetness of malts and some dried fruit notes. There is some bitterness but well balanced. This one was the winner of the night from 10 different beers with my colleagues. Will buy again!
