Pours a creamy milk chocolate brown. Very smooth drinking, caramel and chestnut notes, unnoticeable alcohol merge a subtle range of "autumn" tastes into a harmonious malt shake. Just a tinge of hops to spice things off.

Bottle at home from the brewery. Had this a couple of times before i think. Bottle was a bit of slow gusher. Aroma is spritzy raisin, sweet caramel, caramel, belgian yeast and some hot alcohol. Dark copper red pour with a thin persistent cream head. Flavour is earthy woody raisin and toffee. Palate is very effervesent, tingling on the tongue with medium body. Medium sweet. Tasty malty beer.

Pours a red brown with head which quickly goes. Smells of yeast, sweet malt and dried fruits. Taste is sweet but balanced nicely with the yeasty bitterness and a slight amount of sour. Carbonation levels very noticable. A fine beer indeed!
Bottle. Pours amber with thick toffee head. Sweet malty aroma and sweet malty taste. Excellent.
0,3l Flasche.Dunkelbraunes Bier mit schnell auflösendem Schaum. Schmeckt nach getrockneten Früchten mit einem süßlichen Abgang. Leckeres ausgewognes Trappistenbier!
Brownish cloudy, nice light yellow head. Apricot, citrus carpet aroma. Malt, toffee, caramel, fruit, with a mild metallic hoppines in the aftertaste. High in carbon. A really nice beer.
Buena cerveza trapense de doble fermentación, oscura, espuma poco densa clara, buen sabor para tomar a temperatura ambiente

UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Color marrón rojizo, intenso, con  espuma de color algo más claro, esponjosa y con buena retención. Aroma suave a fruta madura, jarabe de caramelo y alcohol. Cuerpo medio  y elevada carbonatación.  En boca entre picante debido al carbónico, dando paso a fruta madura y algo de especias. Dulce y con suave presencia del alcohol.

Botella de 330ml. Cáliz de La Trappe. Color marrón muy oscuro y apariencia nublada. Espuma beige claro y corona cremosa con bastante buena retención. Aromas de frutos oscuros, leve fenólico, maltas dulces y caramelo, especias y trazos de limón. La entrada presente un gentil sabor tartárico y afrutado que precede a un malteado tostado con matices de chocolate. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Textura densa en un paladar picante y pimentado. En el intermedio, el tono tartárico se eleva con la carbonatación pero, finalmente, las maltas tostadas prevalecen junto a una muy baja lupulización. Final con agradable calor alcohólico y frutas dulces. Deliciosa, compleja, bien equilibrada y buena representante del Estilo.
 
330ml bottle. La Trappe Chalice glass. Dark brown color, cloudy appearance. Light beige foam & creamy crown shows fairly good retention. Dark fruit, slight phenolic, sweet & caramel malt, spiced aromas & lemon hints. Gentle tart & fruity flavors at first followed by toasted maltiness & chocolate hues. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Oily texture. Spicy & peppery palate. Tartiness is enhaced by carbonation but, finally, toasted malts overwhelm it. Very low hoppiness. Kind alcohol heat & sweet fruits into the finish. Delicious, complex, well balanced & nice spot of the Style.
Caramelized banana, super sweet, strong pungent alcohol, carbonation, addition of banana bread when tasting, nutty

330 ml. bottle poured into a Goblet glass 

Appearance....... Black beer with head colour beige of 1.5 finger aprox

Aroma............... malt, yeast and fruits. malty aroma predominance

Taste........ Prune and raisin notes and hop , touch of bitterness too.

Mouthfeel........... medium/full body and soft carbonation 

Overall............ a very recomendable trappist ale, hops are present in a light style.

Bottle 0.33l. Pours deep brown with off white head. Aroma is raisin, cheese, bread, plum. Taste has medium sweetness, lightly bitter, dried fruit, plums. Palate has a medium body, is creamy with soft carbonation and a long time sweet finish. Good Dubbel which hides the 7 ABV very well.
Ensimmäinen trappisti. Odotukset korkealla. Vähän prosentit pelotti, mutta ne ei maistunut ollenkaan. Mahtava suutuntuma ja hyvä neutraali maku. Lisää kiitos!

Verre de dégustation provenant dune bouteille de 330 ml dégusté au Brouhaha (Montréal, QC) au coût de 3,00$. Arôme: Légère odeur de fruité et dalcool. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée foncée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel et de fruit (Prune entre autre) avec une pointe dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #5372)

Rating from 16.2.2008: Sehr schönes cremiges, mildes Bier mit schöner Malz- und Karamellnote. Im Antrunk etwas 
flach entwickelt sich zum Hauptteil hin eine schöne, vollmundige Süße. Im Nachgeschmack ist 
eine ganz leichte Herbe zu spüren, die mit den malzig-schokoladigen Aromen lange anhält. 
Insgesamt ein sehr schönes, süffiges Bier --> 13
It has that nice liquorice taste you tend to find in some doubles. Pretty standard overall. Easy to get in every Dutch supermarket so I drink it quite occasionally.
Poured from a 750ml bottle with some age on it. The aroma is plum, prune, cherries, slight metallic. The flavor is rich breads, dark stone fruits. This is a fantastic Dubbel.

We believe this bottle is from the 90s. Aroma is still great, big raisins and thin sweet malts. Pours dark, mostly unclear chestnut dark brown with no head. Body has died, pretty watered down. Flavor is light almost iced tea malts. Gonna have to try it fresh.

Dark red brown, sizzling frothy tan head, vanished quickly, thin layer remains, some lacing; sweet fruity nose, some caramel, brown sugar, raisin, dark fruits, yeasty, hay, herbal hops, aroma on the whole quite reticent; medium sweet taste, dark fruits, cherries, plum, slightly bitter, earthy impression; medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation; mild sweetbitter finish with fruity undertones that add some acidity.

Castanha licorosa, semi opaca. Creme castanho bem formado e denso.

Aroma intenso, doce, frutado. Delicioso!

Shitake, doce no início, amarga no fim. Alcoolica na medida. Bastante complexa. Ótima carbonatação. Malte torrado aparece também. Um pouco de frutas.

Retrogosto forte e amargo. Alcoolico. Bom pra curtir com um chocolate.

0.33 bottle. Very dark crimson color and a big, off-white head. Aroma is dominated by fruity esters, bananas, biscuit, some caramel, vanilla and yeasts. Sweet, malty taste, again biscuit, delicate caramel, a touch of bananas - really pleasant. Medium body, slick texture and soft carbonation. Finish is relatively long and just as complex as the taste, brings in some cherry flavors into play. Overall a very good beer barely noticeable alcohol despite its large amount; worth recommendation.
Continuing the La Trappe tasting. Dubbel was quite delicious. One of the very best examples of the style.

Bottle- pours brown with a big beige head. Lots of sweet malt, caramel and burnt sugar, also a malty wort smell. Sweet, sweet malt on the taste, the sweetness lasts for quite a while before the bitter hop finish hits. Good carbonation and nice mouthfeel.

Nice dark color and body.
Dark fruits on aroma and taste. Dates for sure.
Nice warm smooth aftertaste.
Very good dubbel beer.

Loved this beer, I had a Quad from La Trappe in Amsterdam tried to get this beer in America was hard to find. I finally found a beermart that would get this beer here in America and I ordered a case and found it to be a wonderful beer too, but love the Quad more. This has a strong flavor and alcohol content, but more citrus flavor I found.
Pours dark red brown. Head quickly disappears. Very nice, sweet aroma. Taste of bananas. Fine carbo. Easily drinkable and very enjoyable. At least on par with Westmalle dubbel.
A nice sweet aroma of berries. Dark hazy amber color. A rich taste of berries, figs and nuts.
This Dutch trappist dubbel is like a hardy piece of whole weat bread. Whith a combination of flavor and a lingering palate it leaves you coming back for more!

Aroma sweet yeast and malt, even some banana somewhere. Dark reddish brown colour with a large beige head that does not stay too long. Taste of caramel, burnt sugar and plum/dried fruit. Awesome thick mouthfeel. One of my favorite trappists.

0,33 bottle.
pours dark brown, almost black, with big tan head.
sweet and yeasty aroma,plum alcohol and berries.
intense flavour of sweet dried fruits, nuts, alcohol and malts. 
really full body, lively but balanced carbonation

330ml bottle. Pours a clear brownish red with a light brown head. Nose is dried fruit, cherry, banana, and light marshmallow. The taste is sweet with dried dark fruit, amaretto, Twizzlers (yup), brown sugar, light molasses, black tea, a light mint nite, and spice. Its good, but its a little too sweet for my tastes. Worth trying, but maybe only once.

bottle @ bierhuyske
pours dark brown, red glow . 
small white foam 
bit sugary smell
thin mourthfeel ( even after i drank a 0,4 abv beer ) 
filthy sugary sweetness, as im used to in la trappe 
bit earthyness
not good , also , as im used to from la trappe .

Amber light ruby red colour with some CO2. Liht tan fast fading head. Lovely balanced sweet aromas of bsiquit, sugar cane and ripe banana notes arise. At first your palate discovers a bit of a harsh fizzyness which fades mediumly and leaves you with a light prickling bit velvet texture. Medium-full bodied beer with medium sweet and some bitter taste notes. The finish is balanced and lingers silently pleasant on the back of the palate leaving some hints of the fizzyness.

Bottle 33cl. Small brown layer. Dark red brown color. Aroma is caramel, prune and roasted chocolate malt. Taste is sugar, gooseberries, bread, syrup and toffee. Nice mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mooi donker robijn kleurig bier. Volle zoete smaak met een klein bittertje, met een vleugje vanille.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Very slight brown sugar aroma, dark brown in color... Slightly sweet, not much in terms of bitterness... Not a tremendously impressive trappist, not much complexity, but a good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

poured a deep amber red colour, with a big white head that faded fast. roasted malts, sweet sugar, dark fruits, caramel, and some belgian yeast in the taste. deep warm taste. think this one is way better as the quadruppel
Eén van de laatste bieren van La trappe (de normale dan) die ik nuttig. Lekker zachte dubbel, makkelijk drinkbaar.

Recenzja 16 lipca 2011 Kolor ciemnoczerwony, przechodzący w brunatny, mętny. Zapach owocowo-kwiatowy, bardzo przyjemny, alkohol nie wyczuwalny. W smaku bardzo rześki, o mocnej nucie owocowej, na pierwszym planie smak jabłka (a nawet bardziej jabłecznika).

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Tatoverede Enke, Copenhagen - Brown/amber pour with good persistent creamy off white head. Sweet caramel malty, toffee, nutty, brown sugar, christmas cake, choc, dark fruits. Lovely.

Dark copper, dark red. Lots of fizzy, light brown head. Malt, caramel, pepper and slight vanilla aroma. Some pear and apple. Sweet, with a bit of sourness. Fizzy mouth feel. A bit on the sour side, but good and a beer with interesting aromas.

donker bruin/rood met bruine kraag
aroma van donker fruit, rozijnen, banaan, zoet, vanille
smaken: fruitig, caramel, matig zoet, banaan, licht bitter, mout, vanille
redelijke body, goed bier !

Shared a 33cl bottle from Delheize. Pours a brown colour with a thick tan head. Aroma is caramel, malt and fruity. Medium carbonation and almost full body. Flavour is too complex and full filing. Good!

Creamy, tasty - a Real quality Beer from the beginning until the last drop (all temperatures fit well). Really rich taste map - maple syrup, chocolate, capuccino, roasted pees. This is an enjoyment that doesnt need anything to accompany - just itself. Dont try to have anything else after this.
Christmas cake, brandy, plum; delicate mouth feel; other than disappointing head dissipation, perfect!
Christmas Cake in a glass. Bread on the nose, fruit and spices on the nose as well, with a heavily cloying almost spirit like shock to the back of the throat which lingered for many a moment
UPDATED: JUL 24, 2015 Pleasant aroma of bread, roasted malts, some spices. Medium sweet with a light bitter finish. Could use a bit more body. Nice dubbel regardless.
Dark amber with thin head. Musty yeast and light sweet malt aroma. Mix of spice and roast that just doesnt sit all that well.

Amazing mahogany finish with a barley ridden flavor. The La trappe dubbel appeals to the beer enthusiast in me at more than one level. Im all for belgian beer and this does not disappoint. If you like basic ingredient based beer, with a rewarding flavor, give this a shot.

Bottle from intermarche senhora da Rocha, Portugal hazy dark chestnut, cola and plums on nose. Extremely sweet, full bodied, low carb, slight offwhite head, long prune finushz touch plasticity but not as much candy sugar as some, very little yeast esters. Vegetal as it warms.
Mørk rødbrun farge. Bra med skum ved skjenking. Avtar og blir ikke liggende.lukter noe karamell og fruktig. Smaker også fruktig og har medium pluss med kullsyre.

dark ruby color, off-white long lasting small foam; coffee, chocolate, fruity (blackberries and others) aroma, some caramel; medium sweetness, very lightly bitter and sour, overall a bit dryish/wineish; medium body, rather creamy feel, soft carbonation, long semi-dry finish;
Overall: very good beer, without flaws

Flaska. Mörkbrunröd med smutsvitt skum. Här är det mycket i både smak och doft. Och gott. I det sistnämnda hittas banan, knäck, lime och ljus choklad. I det förra återkommer banan och choklad tillsammans med fruktkaka, grape och röda äpplen. Sötman och beskan trivs ihop.

Smooth and malty with bitter finish without the earthy background. Typical belgian complicated and multidimensional tastes however this dubbel is very much more approachable than its belgian cousins. I like the big bottle with champagne cork and how the beer looks in glass. Very dark brown, nice head however not the immortal one-vanishes quite rapidly. Overall very pleasant solid dubbel without fireworks, drinkable and easy.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a diminishing frothy beige head. Aroma is estery with bubblegum, pear, acetone, toasted malt, bread, raisins, spice and vinous. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Body is light+, texture is thin, carbonation is high. Finishes dry light astringent with roasted notes.

30cl bottle at home. Clear dark amber with a white head. Medium body with quite some carbonation. Sweet with some bitterness in the end. Caramel, roast, bread, smoke and some chocolate. Im usually not a fan of dubbels, but this a nice, complex, full flavoured beer which I liked a lot!
Lots-o-barley with lingering warming alcohol. Nicely balanced and plenty of body. As the beer warms in the glass, additional character makes its way through in the form of spice and apple.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2014 Slightly hazy beautiful light mahogany body with distinguishable particles floating around.  The at first large beige head quickly settles down. Nose has notes of yeast, caramel, raisins and walnuts. Taste has a full and sweet start with a lightly dry finish. Palate is rich and malty with lots of huge bubbles. Overall very nice and well balanced but ends up feeling slightly light and thin.

Bread, caramel, toffee, and molasses in the aroma. Flavor is mild for a Trappist, but still very pleasant. Starts sweet and bready with caramel and toffee. Some spice, a little bitterness, and a hint of smoke in a somewhat thin finish. A fine beer but not quite up there with the very best dubbels.
750ml bottle. foamy head, malty aroma. high carbonation. sweet taste of  fruits and brown sugar, aftertaste a bit watery. not bad but does not match a westmalle.
Poured a dark brown with a tan ring. Aroma of sweet dark fruit. Medium body, flavour of plum, light cheery, raisin with a bitter sweet finish.
One of the better dubbel beers. Very balanced taste of roasted malt, caramel and some bitterness.
Bottle at oak barrel, helsinki airport. Hazy dark brown color, small white head. Aroma is nice sweet malts, plum, raisin. Balanced sweet little roasted malty taste, plum, raisin, little hoppy end.
Mørk amber farve med gyllent skum. Lukt av malt og frukt. Smak av frukt, malt og honning.
Frisk duft av krydder og banan. sittende skum. mørk brun farge. Søtlig smak av banan.

Oak-dark in colour, dense head. Distinct notes of yeast, plumb, apricose and other dried fruits are present in the aroma. The taste has similar notes as the aroma, but is supported by maltiness. Refreshing, slightly bitter and malty finish.

Dark brown beer with a lot of carbonation bubbles on the surface with a brief medium off beige head. Caramel, dark sweet bread, ripe fruits on the nose. Crispy mouth feel. Medium body at first but leaves a little watery in the finish. Slight sourness and bitterness. Caramel notes but not very sweet. Theres a hint of both sweetness and dryness in it. Quite a good beer. I wish it had a bit more full body though.
Pours a deal amber with a thin cream colour head. Aromas of roasted nuts, brown butter, spices and some hints of dark fruits. Nice palatable beer. Nice malt profile. Awesome balance.
Complex and excelent beer. Fruit taste with nuts. You can feel the alcohol, but it matches perfectly with the rest.

Nice clear brownish appearance - clear thick foam. You can taste sweet marziane aromas, with light bitterness.

Very nice experience

Bottle from Tesco. Amber/brown colour with tan head. Malty aroma with some fruits. Taste is very sweet, with some hints of spices and banana. Light bitterness in the finish. The alcohol is well hidden. Slightly overpriced, but still a very good beer. I liked it very much.
UPDATED: AUG 5, 2016 Mooie diepe donkerrode kleur. Mooi schuim. Zoete geur van mout, caramel en iets hop en vanille. Smaakt lekker. Geen uitgesproken smaak. Tonen karamel, vanille en mout.
Cerveja com teor baixo alcoólico. Acopanha muito bem carnes. Preço representa um bom custo benefício.

Immedeatly after I opened a 33cl bottle (exp. date: 05/2015), the carbonation foam rushed up into the bottle. Its not the first time it happened with beers from La Trappe. Poured in a deep red, brownish beer which was a bit hazy and having a thick light-brown head which dissapeared quickly.
Aroma is sour, with roasted malts and yeasty. Taste is quite complex with its sour and sweet in the beginning fallowing some bitterness at the end. Mostly sweet. Spices, herbs, malts, yeast en bread. Medium mouthfeel and too much carbonation. Overall a nice beer, but I prefer the Westmalle Dubbel.

On tap @ Proeflokaal Arendsnest, Amsterdam, Netherlands. Pours with a very dark red, tan frothy medium lasting head. Aroma is moderately malty, fruiity, especially banana, little hoppy, herbs, little yeasty. Taste is moderately to heavy sweet, a bit bitter, a bit sour, a bit salty. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, medium lasting sweet finish.
Enjoyed this wonderful dubbel on tap in a La Trappe chalice at Fred's Rivertown Alehouse. Loved every sip!

Appearance: Red/brown, clear with off white head about 1cm thick formed of large bubbles.
Aroma: Banana, peach, fruit cake, spice, malty, bread and bubblegum.
Taste: Marzipan, light sweetness, light bitterness and medium sourness.
Palate: Thin, light body, slick texture, lively carbonation, with a quick dry finish.
Comments: Very good, it will be on the next shopping list. No glass lace.
Tap en fles, diverse malen gedronken. Zeker geen verkeerd dubbel, maar tikkeltje dun en teveel suiker in gebruikt, zou meer body mogen hebben. Als ik de keuze heb dan ga ik toch voor westmalle.
caramel and toffe aroma.  appear dark borwn and with a frothy head.  taste sweet with bitter notes.  nice palate.

Slightly hazy red-broown colour, with a decent sized beige head, a bit of unsettled sediment. Aroma is fruity, caramel malt, yeast. Taste is blanaced, sweet, with a light sour finish of average-long duration. Texture is oily but a little watery, mody is medium, carbonation is average-lively. Good beer.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 Ruby reddish brown clear beer with a beige frothy head. Aroma is sweet with ripe banana, caramel, darker fruits, Belgian yeast and malts. Taste is licoricy sweet, herbal, peppery spicy, Belgian yeasty and toffeey. Theres a fair amount of bitterness on the finish carrying on other elements of the taste. Mouthfeel is thicker than medium and quite heavily carbonated. Pouring the yeast in makes the beer hazy and makes the aroma and taste drier. I liked it better without the yeast. A really good dubbel.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours Dark Brown hazy murky With big fluffy head. Notes of nuts , great belg yeast, creamy smooth. Just great yeast. Wonderful beer.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Reddish brown colour, thick white head. Quite high carbonation. Malty, fruity, yeasty aroma. Smooth malty flavour, fruit cake, pleasant soft mouthfeel, sweetish. Some alcohol warmth in the finish. Good stuff!

I have to say back in 1997 I had a purely amazing bottle of this in Tramonto, a Greek beer bar under the Koningshoeven label. That was low carbonation, must have been aged a long time, immensely concentrated fruit flavours, and would have got a way higher score!

750ml bottle, shared with friends over Catan. Dark red / brown clear color. Minimal off-white head. Couple loose dots of lace. Bigger body. Soft, light to moderate carbonation. Nice dark fruit, light spice, light cinnamon in the nose.. Moderate sweet taste, light spice, light savory. Nice example of a belgian dubbel.
Caramel, bread, nuts, toast, roasty, spruce, leather, clove, licorice, raisin, woody, smoke, bottle conditioned ? doppio malto (dubbel)
Draft in Holland, 5th June 2013. Pours dark brown, loads of flavour, burnt sugar, plump booze soaked raisin and fruit, quite complex, drinks smooth, nice

Dark brown pour, aromas of malt and yeast with notes of plum. Nice malty mouthfeel, easy to drink, 7% abv and light enough that I could drink a few of these and be happy but flavorful enough for it to still be recognized as a quality trappist brew. Pairs really well with food.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2013 Bottle. Pours a dark mahogany color with a thin tan head, that leaves a nice lacing. Pleasant aroma of dark fruits, sweetness, malts and caramel. Taste is similar to the smell, very balanced mixture of caramel, dark fruits, raisins, malts and yeasts, slight bitter aftertaste, medium body. Great dubbel.

Bought a bottle at the supermarket. Aroma of dark malt, brown sugar and spices. Has a deep red brown color and cream colored head, and is highly carbonated. Taste is sweet (tones of fruits) with a light bitter, aromatic and dry aftertaste. A good trappist, I like it.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 The aroma is something unique: yellow fruit, red fruit, banana, caramel, biscuit, nuts, bubblegum, some alcohol. The phenols are subdued: just some pepper and very very hidden hints of clove. I dont know... it reminds me Christmas time when I was a child. Very clean ruby color with a tasty tan head. Sweet but not cloying, medium bodied. I payed less than 3 euros for it in a supermarket and its giving me such a bunch of emotions. It represents the roots we all have to start again from.

Très belle bouteille au blason en relief et le nom Trappist.
Couleur très jolie brun foncé. Clarté nette. Bulles fines et vives en fontaine au centre.
Mousse beige clair crémeuse.
Arômes de fruits mûrs, épices, muscade, santal, bois de fût.
1ère bouche à la texture soyeuse, fine, un peu sur le bois de réglisse, avec du candi brun
et des figues. Arrière-bouche avec des céréales et du fruit confit.
2ème bouche avec une pointe danis sur des épices, un rien de poivre du moulin.
3ème bouche à la « saveur douce mais au bouquet prononcé »(dixit le brasseur), et cest 
tout à fait la description de cette bouche.
Longueur avec de très belles saveurs, délicates et épicées.
Levure très (trop?) soft.
Alcool qui tient la route.
Finale qui a juste un rien tendance à descendre, ce qui suffit à pénaliser la note de cette
bière. 
Belle bière mais qui ne répond pas à la même complexité que la quadruple, et surtout
qui descend un rien sur la finale.

Ambré foncé, mousse tombe rapidement. Huileuse au palais, trop pétillante en bouche. Caramel, réglisse, pain rôti et amertume caféinée dominent cette trappiste double de loin inférieure à mon goût à celle de Westmalle.
Bottle. Pours amber brown with a foamy light tan head. Aroma was lightly sweet with caramel, yeast and fruit. Flavor was sweet & malty with dark friut, caramel, raisins, toffee and some light spices

Cerveza color caoba, de espuma vigorosa al inicio para quedar al poco tiempo una cremosa corona. Olor afrutado, enebro, plátano. Sabor tostado, chocolateado, muy especiado, notas de vino tinto, azucar moreno, manzana asada al vino. Cuerpo medio, con gas vivo en la boca y con un fondo sorprendentemente seco. Presencia alcohólica.
33cl bottle @ home. One of the best dubbels for me. Not too sweet. Nice brown color. Has a little taste of caramel.
From 75cl bottle in original glass. Pours with a quickly dissapearing head; flat brown. Bittersweet with nice and medium soft carbonization. Mostly caramel and dark bread. Bitter finish.

Keg @ Den Tatoverede Enke. The pours deep brown with a small head. The aromas red apple, plum, forest fruit. Belgian yeasty sweetness. The taste is more plum, pear. Mild spice and toffee. Sweet finish. Full body, soft carbonation. Overall, OK. Quite sweet.

Beautiful looking beer, dark brown in colour. Very typical belgian head which doesnt go anywhere. Its like an cloud on top of my beer. Scent has some sweetness but is dominated by this red wine type of smell, perhaps tannins? Taste is sweet, with bread like malts, and some cream at the end. Some roasted feel at start but it stays behind. Something is missing here, could be better.

Serving: from bottle.

Aroma: light, banana aroma.

Appearance: small, rocky, light-brown, initial head with no lacing and fully diminishing longevity.  Hazy, dark-red/light brown body.

Taste: moderately sweet, cherry and caramel-like, initial flavor and finish with average duration.

Palate: medium body, oily texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: very good.  Interesting flavor.

Aged 750 ml bottle served in a St. Bernardus snifter.  
Pours more-or-less clear, dark ruby-mahogany in color, with a nice fluffy cream colored head.  The head initially leaves nice lacing on the glass, but it has poor retention and soon reduces to a thin ring.
Aroma: rich and complex, but gentle aroma of dark fruits and spices, with suggestions of raisins, dates, figs, toffee, brown sugar, banana, flowers, brown bread, cinnamon, chocolate and some earthy yeast. Fantastic aroma! 

Taste: rich, dynamic and complex; mildly bitter/sweet with suggestions of raisins, dates, figs, toffee, brown sugar, banana, brown bread, chocolate and some spicy yeast.  Lingering notes of dark fruits, chocolate, dark malts and light spicing.  

Medium carbonation and medium+ body. Slightly harsh; about as expected with 7% ABV.

Overall: this excellent Dubbel lives up to its reputation. Great balance and complexity  Alcohol is partially hidden but with light warming after the finish. Exceptionally enjoyable.

Draft at Bulldog Downtown. Bearing in mind this beer is achingly wanting to be a quadrupel, a very solid beer. Sweet aroma with almost hints of date. Starts well with malty sweetness and a full mouthfeel but stops short of excellence.

Draft at Eulogy. Wonderful rich dark copper pour with islands of white foam. Glows like a candy red apple in front of bright light. Sugar plums. Dried cherries. Cinnamon. Rhubarb. Currents. Rich sweet malty dark red fruit. Touch sour. Notable spice for balance. Medium-full body. Very nice refined Dubbel. Much better than I was expecting. This is the only major La Trappe brew that I had not had and am now kicking myself for not having it earlier. Found it on draft here, not sure if the bottle is a match in taste.

On tap. Pours a deep brownish colour with a large off-white head. Taste of malt, caramel, sweet fruity flavours and spices. Very sweet, with an above-medium body, and some bitter hops in the aftertaste. One of the best Dubbels Ive had.
Good beer. Not my favorite.. Long finish and good texture. taste is sour and bitter..

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ One finger foam. Amber clear. Fruity cloves caramel aromas. Fine dryness with a sweet finish. Fresh and still complex. Nice dubbel.

Direkt från kran vid klostrets provhall i La Trappe. Fantastisk arom och utseende med massor av skum. Mkt jästsmak som det ska vara!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
August 2010. From bottle. Poured dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of dark fruit, coriander, roasted malts and spice.

Poured a pretty deep brown, medium beige head. Scents of nuts and dried fruits, and toasty malts. Flavor is quite sweet and bitter, heavy carbonation, a bit too much for my taste, somewhat fruity beer smooth alcohol flavor that warms the mouth and the stomach too. Well done, good Dubbel.

Head: Big, beige, frothy to creamy head. Colour: deep red and clear, almost black. 

Aroma: dried fruit like prunes and raisins, malty, caramel. Taste: caramel, dried fruit, bit bitter, roasted, spicy, a touch of alcohol.

A quite enjoyable evening-style beer.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 Very well made double with a lot of flavor and balance. Lovely nose, with hints of dried fruits and candied almonds. The flavor has a distinctive malt flavor.

Bottle @ home. Profumo di cereali tostati, un po di caffè e di liquerizia. Schiuma compatta e cremosa dal perlage fine poco persistente( meno di 1 minuto). Interessante il gusto, ritornano i malti tostati, io ho avvertito anche un aroma di caffè e sul finale (lungo e amrognolo) si avverte una luppolaura genrosa per questo stile. Il corpo non è pieno, ha una consistenza quasi da thè...e la carbonatazione è lieve.

Bottled, 0.33l. Hazy dark brown color with thick creamy tan-like head, average visible carbonation and nice lacing. Aroma of dried fruits and berries, yeast caramel and toasted malt. Taste starts with sweet and rich malt, well toasted, then followed by spicy yeastiness. Alcohol is quite present, therefore mouthfeel is very warming, while aftertaste is mild bitter with prevailing sweet maltiness. Full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. I almost feel trapped with La Trappe :)

Pours a perfect beer. Nice brown red color and a good white head. 
I smelled some sweet tones. Fruity. The taste is nice. Bit bitter and sweet. 
The carbo is lively. A bit to much carbo. Medium body and a sticky texture.

On tap at Radagast Biergarten, Brooklyn. Pours dense but not jazy chocolate color with a trace head. Big, sweet caramel aroma. Full cherry, chocolate and raisin flavor with a long, sweet tail. Body is full with almost no carbonation. Overall Im not a fan of sweet beers, so its not a fav.

My bottle was 2009 vintage, drank this spring ( April 20130).  This was delicious.  In the classic mold of a Trappist double- dark brown nice head that lasts a little while, molasses, dark fruit , the usual wonderful flavors, but done in a very good way- An under-rated dubbel.
Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, belgisk jäst, mycket frukt och toner av banan, honung och örter. En riktig bra belgare.

Comes out of the bottle a mouth-watering clear sienna with a fairly thick, if not very persistent, tan head. Malty aroma has subtle fruity and honey tones and a hint of brown sugar. Robust flavor fills the mouth with sweet malt, banana, caramel and honey tones swirling about. Smooth texture has a good amount of fizz and thickness, dancing down the pipes to the tummy. Good work, monks!

Deep copper with a cherry red tint and a fizzy, disappearing, lacy, off-white head. Smells of toasted malt and yeast with caramel, alcohol and a underlining fruitiness that makes me think of figs. Smooth full oily body with faint carbonation. Deep. Tastes of sweet caramel malt with toasted malt and figs with a nutty note that that becomes more fruity on the finish. Full malty taste and soft spices. Very easy to drink and in a year or so it will be perfect.

de couleur brun ambre on ressent tout de suite des arome de fruit confits  caramel brule en bouche c est un gout liquoreux de de fruit confit , le caramel brule et levure qui lui procure une finesse en bouche c est un delice (rate71)

750 ml bottle into chalice, 07/10 printed on the cork.  Pours very hazy and cloudy dark ruby red color with a nice 1-2 finger dense and fluffy cream colored head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation.  Aromas of big raisin, pear, apple, caramel, brown sugar, light banana, pepper, floral, clove, brown bread, candi sugar, and earthy yeast spiciness.  Fantastic aromas with great complexity and balance of fruity/spicy esters with malt sweetness.  Taste of raisin, apple, pear, caramel, brown sugar, pepper, clove, light banana, floral, herbal, brown bread, candi sugar, and earthy yeast spiciness.  Lingering notes of light fruits, caramel, brown sugar, light banana, pepper, clove, brown bread, floral, herbal, and earthy yeast spiciness on the finish for a bit.  Damn nice balance and complexity of fruity/spicy ester with malt sweetness; with great robustness and zero cloying sweetness present after the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a smooth, fairly slick, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is great.  Alcohol is very well hidden with hardly any warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a highly excellent Dubbel!  Great balance and complexity of malt and fruity/spicy esters; and very smooth and crisp to sip on.  A highly enjoyable offering.
From my own database, without comment. Will update when I re-rate this beer.

Dubble beer. Small and diminishing head. Malty and yeasty aromas. Toasted and caramel notes. A slightly hoppy hint. In mouth it presents and average body and a bit oily.  Sweet flavor. High carbonation

Filip

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown color with a moderate, but quickly disappearing, tan head. Nose has some sweetness in there, and you can smell the Belgian yeast. Taste has some dark fruit elements in there, too. And seems a bit light. Interesting.
Bottle. Hazy reddish brown color with a thin cloudy head. Aroma of syrup, yeast and caramel with notes of lemon. Sour and medium bitter taste. Some sour glue in finish.
I loved the aroma on this one. It is a great beer, very drinkable but it doesnt have the touch of a high-level beer. Definitely one of those beers i want to try again.

Appearance was cloudy caramel brown with diminishing off white creamy 1 finger head, no lacing. Aromas are sweet caramel, chocolate, hints of smoke,nut, spice of nutmeg, cloves and port. Fruity yeasts create wonderful smells. Taste are sweet dark malts, dark fruits of plum, raisin, date, fig and cherry with clean bready yeasts, alcohol is warming. Palate was creamy smooth CO2 with medium body, then velvety average length wonderful complex finish. Beautiful Trappest.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2014 Pours brown-red in color with a high greyish foam head. Tastes sweet with a lasting fruity palate in the throat. Overall an unusual flavor that?s nice as long as you drink this slowly.
Great full aroma, surely the best attribute. Taste is less complex, seems a little bit too aged. Sweetness is clearly present.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 0,33l bottle. Dark amber color with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is burnt sugar, caramel and dark fruits. Taste is sweet with pronounced candy sugar character. Medium to full body. Overall its very good beer.
Espuma que desaparece ensegida de color marron oscuro, en nariz caramelo y frutas oscuras, maltosa. De entrada dulce y maltosa en boca con recuerdos a caramelo y ciruelas o frutos oscuros.
Fine head, Dark redbrown. Fat nose with sugar, orange and light peach. Medium body and Some length. Taste is alså peach and Brown sugar.nice

UPDATED: APR 12, 2014 At very low temperature is undrinkable, but at true medium temperature is excelent, ruby amber color with persistent good tan head, aroma is of dark caramel, roasted malt, in the mouth is full, smooth, the principal sensations are roasted malt and liquorice touch, expecially in aftertaste.

Brown Sugar with a touch of roast malt in the nose. Deep brown with a cream colored cap. Roast malt and earth hop on bitterness blend with brown sugar sweetness. Medium plus bodied with a balanced finish.

Corked & Caged 750 ml Bottle. Appearance is a cloudy dark reddish brown color with a cap of tan foam. The aroma has notes of Belgian yeast, toffee, plums and dates. The taste blends candi sugars, yeast and caramel upfront along with some clove, raisin, chocolate and brown sugar to round things out. The body is creamy with strong carbonation and a spiced, malty finish. Overall, an enjoyable Trappist style Dubbel.

Dark brown/red with a very thin head. Aroma is fruity and sweet.
Taste is bittersweet with (dark) fruits and moderate carbonation.

Bottle 33cl.
Warm and sweet aroma, some roasted.
Redbrown, large tan foamy head.
Aroma comes back in the taste, with a nutty taste.
Semi-sticky mouthfeel.
brown red like color with a nice beuge head.Aroma of sweet syrup and citrus fruits and maybe som roasted malts with nice bitterness

Bottle from E.Leclerc Supermarket, Portimao, Portugal. A very dark red-brown beer with a superbly rich red fruity flavour, notes of currants and marzipan followed by creamy, smooth vanilla and oak on the finish.
reddish-brown colour, minimal beige head; aroma of candy sugar and yeast with sourish fruits; taste of roasted sugar with some alcohol and intensive, long lasting bitterness; correct ale

Excelente Dubbel de abadia, essa holandesa trapista traz notas adocicadas no aroma de frutas secas logo antes do primeiro gole. Cor escura, traz ao paladar notas frutadas e malhadas, com sabor residual que lembra nozes e especiarias. Carbonataçao extrema, com otimo corpo, como outras da escola belga, com ótimo drinkability. Excelente cerveja!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle from mathieuc, thanks! pours hazy light brown with anice creamy beige head, some retention and lacing. caramel, toffee, toasted cereals with nuts, spices, candi, licorice, spicy la trappe yeast - some fruity esters - bananas. grassy-peppery light to medium hopping. average to soft carbonation, light to medium body. what you definitely expect from a dubbel.
Trappist beer...nuff said. taste of dried fruits, some sourish aroma, small beige oil slick head. Just wonderful.

Donker trappistenbier. Geur: mout, caramel. Smaak: zoetig bier, gedroogd fruit, pruimen, rozijnen, caramel. De koolzuur draagt bij aan een frisse smaak (bijna zuurtje op de tong). Heerlijk bier, goed in balans.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2013 Pours cloudy brown-reddish with huge beige creamy top, thin lacing are leaving afterwards, bubbly.  Aroma of toasted malt, some tones of bread, darker malt and raisins, no yeast or hops, a bit alcohol; semisweet flavor all-around. Taste is sour-sweet with mild bitter from toasted malt and chocolate in afterpath. Mild dry finish, close to full body, creamy pleasant mouthfeel, not very complex flavor. Overall - I was bit disappointed, cause expected more sweet and yeasty pattern. This one reminds me more of Vienna style.

Brown with red tint with good head that dissipated quickly.  Banana and cherry aroma, sweet and fruity with a slight musk.  A little grain and banana flavor with nutty/yeasty full aftertaste. Moderate sticky mouthfeel.  Highly carbonated.  Not my favorite Trappist but good.  Josh bought in St. Louis and brought over.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong banana smell.  Banana and slightly cherry taste dissipating to alcohol.  Little malt flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kaatuu lasiin rubiininpunaisena vaahdon ollessa vaaleanruskea ja tiivis. Kestää tovin ennen kuin laskee.. Haju on vahvan mausteinen, jonka lisäksi löytyy leipäisyyttä, kevyttä hedelmäisyyttä ja marjoja. Maku on kuivatun hedelmäinen, pippurinen, ruhoinen, hunajaisen makea, hieman yrttinen ja limppuinen. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen ja loppua kohti melko täyttävä. Kokonaisuutena tämä on perusvarmaa tasoa, muttei itselleni nouse mitenkään erikoiseksi. kevyt ja "helppo" trappisti.

Head: beige foam, shrinking. Colour: clear ruby brown. Aroma: hops,caramel, sweet. Taste: bittersweet, metalic.. Palate:  medium bittersweet finish, medium CO2. Overall: nice.

33oml bottle, poured into Leffe chalice. Amber to auburn in colour, looked pale for a Dubbel, opaque, 1 finger ginger tanned head, lots of lacing retained. Aroma was dark chocolate, cranberry and molasses. Tasted dark chocolate, cranberry, malt and molasses, slightly boozy, decent complexity. Body on the thick side, decent carbonation, smooth. Overall it reminded me of a German Doppelbock, nice colder weather beer.

Bottle at Cafe De la Gare.  Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan head.  Aroma of raisins, caramel, prunes, overripe dark fruit, malt and leather.  Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter.  Medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation.  A good double.

Bottle at home, Noel Cuvelier, 01/01/13.
Pours mid chestnut brown with a thin tan head that attempts to form a film atop the glass but falls just short!
Nose is toffee, prunes, dates, sugars, yeast esters, banana drops.
Taste follows, sweet malts, sweet sugars, toffee, a little bread, yeast esters, dark fruits, butterscotch, banana.
Medium bodied with bite, prickly carbonation, a little over cooked here for me.
Decent enough Dubbel, well balanced and hits all the right flavour notes - shame they cant tone down the fizziness a notch!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pours dark brown with a small cream head. Sweet aroma with some yeasty notes. Medium body with a nice sweet finish. Good middle of the road Dubbel.
Pours dark brown, with no head. Aroma is sweet fruit and brown sugar. Taste is rather sweet. Medium bodied, very good. Finishes sweet and rather dry.
Dark hazy golden brown colour with medium off-white head. Fruity aroma with dough and brown sugar. Medium bodied. Quite dry on the tongue with a slightly bitter, almost coffee-like finish.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Definitely one of the better from La Trappe. Malty aroma with a bit higher carbo than usual. Still not the creme de la creme but a solid one.

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Dark ruby-brown in colour with steady and creamy head. Taste of honey, brown sugar, pure yeast, soft yeast dough and fresh grains. Easy to drink. It is very rich and intense but also light and fresh.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with airy beige head. Pleasant, clear aroma of malt with notes of caramel, raisins, and booze. Sweet flavour of malt, caramel and dried fruit. Round, bittersweet finish. Yummy.

330ml bottle. Sweet, some caramel and spicy aromas. Pours very dark, with tan head, huge, cremay, persistent, some lacework. Medium body, average to high carbonation. Taste is deep sweet, caramel, some roasty notes detected, also with spices. Enjoyable and nice.

Bottle at Baran, Bergen. Pours a clear deep reddish brown colour with a small light beige head. Aromas of dried apricot, brown sugar, leather, chocolate and dark berries. Wonderful! Much of the same stuff in the flavour but with more leather and sweet dark malt. The ending is a bit dry. Has a slick and rich mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. A fantastic and well-balanced abbey dubbel.

330ml bottle from the Crafty Pint, Darlington Market. Pours a brown ruby amber colour, bubbly tan head, and aroma is caramel, raisin, tart cherry fruit. Initial tangy acidic cherry taste with some bitterness, followed by sweetish caramel and raisin notes, through to a dry sourish bitter finish. Quite drinkable.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2012 33 cl bottle. Good dubbel. Reddish brown color, with little to non-existent head. Aroma of dark fruits and brown sugar. Medium body and soft carbonation. There are better dubbels out there, but La Trappe is a staunch example of the class. Cheers!

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 12/2012
Aroma has raisins, toffee typical to an aged Belgian ale and brown sugar. Flavour has burned sugar, some raisins, toffee, dark fruits and Belgian yeast. Palate is too high on CO2. Good, has not suffered from the aging. Didnt get any better though.

#234
Rötlich braun mit leichter Trübung; tolles Aroma nach Hefeteig und Frucht (Pfirsich bilde ich mir ein); im Antrunk dann kraftvoll und würzig, wobei es gegen Ende auch herber wird. Der Alk.Gehalt beträgt bei meinem Six-Pack 7% und ist geschmacklich nur zu erahnen, weil sehr gut durch das Malz abgepuffert. Alles in allem ein leckerer Trappist, nur das Flaschenlabel ist mir zu bieder. Slainte!
	
Test vom 25.2.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,12,12,12,10,12 - 11,80

I have had this one many many times but never rated it. Pours an average creamy light brown head that mostly diminishes. Body is red brown and sparkles are visible. Aroma contains caramel, lemon, dough, raisin, plum, cherry and alcohol. Flavor starts off acidic (lemon and cherry) and there's a hint of bitterness, to be followed by sweetness (caramel, raisin) and the finish is light bitter and a light alcohol. Palate is medium, with soft carbonation and a creamy texture. It is not very complex but balanced and very drinkable. Can I have another one, please!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

The head is ok, the body red-black. It smells CO², yeasty, fruity, cherry. Taste is very fresh and young, a bit fruity, cherry, a bit sirup. Could be a bit older, it´s not ready, but also ok. 11/10/9/10/11/10
Brown chestnut mokka medium foamy head, soft sweet lollypop fruit smell, bitter liquorise medium carbonation cherry hints taste

Draft at la Mayor, Madrid.  Rosy reddish brown, obviously full-bodied.  Firm, thin white head of light tan foam.  Light sugary aroma.  Brown sugar and wild funk predominate, mellowing as it warms and your palate adjusts.  Good, classic.  (#4847, 12/2012)
330ml bottle. Clear brown, with some red hue, in color. Tiny head, stays. Raisins, caramel, sweet aroma. Alcohol, sweet, yeasty, raisins in flavor. Weird sidetaste (mop?).

Bottle at Huppel The Pub, Den Haag. Poured a murky dark brown colour with a thin tan head. The aroma is light but yeasty. The flavour is weak bitter with lots of yeast malt and some yeasty medicinal notes on the palate. A super beer and one that I can easily drink all night long.

Not sure if my taste has moved, but this aint cutting it. Its fine, feels kinda classic dubbel, but not really to my flavour preference. Think Im a bigger fan of tripels. Anyway, not much linger, some dark fruit, creamy head yes. Just ok.
Ruby/dark cherry corlo w/big head and nice lacing. Big raisins, figs, cherries and plums on the nose.  Taste is cherries, figs and malty sweetness.  Tasty

Smells yeasty with a good dose of what tastes like marshmallow. Very good for style, yeast is consistent with La Trappes other beers. They all have a similar vein of aroma. Pours mahogany with soft carbonation. Aftertaste has a little sourness and a final bit of astringency. Bottle.

Small bottle. Red amber body with a medium beige head. Aroma has mild roast and some yeastiness with some raisins. Light body with dried fruit and medium hoppiness. Not as dark as the Belgian Trappist dubbels but still quite flavoursome. No yeast at the bottom of the bottle.

30cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy amber brown, with white head. 
Aroma is ripe tropical fruits, banana, citrus, apple. 
Taste nice sweet, soft, fresh. 
Mouth-feel thin, carbo gives it a bite. 
Nice dubbel, drinkable.

Aroma is of tropical fruit, lots of banana and pear. Taste isnt as heavy as Id imagined it would be. Rather like a wheat beer - loads of banana, coconut, pear drops. No bitterness, but a little twang from the carbonization - which keeps a nice lasting head.
Pretty good - the first out of the triple, quad and oak aged quad I have from them.....:)

Bottle of 300 ml at home.
Dark amber colour with a two finger brown head, with great retention.Aroma of fruits, banana, citrus. Taste is bitter at first, like a bitter chocolate, at the end bitter-sweet.A bit of caramel there. Thick in body and average carbonation. Overall a really great beer!

Nose is full of caramel, candi and some spicy esters. Nice, civilized head that shows up and then subsides leaving a nice white ring with heavy lacing. Hearty with a nice malt backbone, there is not much hop aromatics/flavors. Smooth carbonation makes the experience ever so more enjoyable. This right here is my favorite dubbel.
bruin red color. toffy and roasted malt flavor. smooth. sweet caramel. full body

Aromas: Notas principales a malta y levadura. Ligeramente se perciben olores frutales.

En cuanto al color, cerveza oscura con notas rubí a la luz. Cuerpo medio, corona de espuma abundante y de larga retennción. Carbonataión ligera.

En boca suave y cremosa, con final aterciopelado.

Al paladar el liquido suave se percibe algo espeso dando un bun cuerpo a la bebida. A pesar de ser una cervea con un grado alcohólico considerable, no se percibe sino hasta que pasa por la garganta. La cremosidad invade nuevamente la boca dejando una agradable y ligera sensación de Dulzor. Final de media duración.

En fomra general se trata de una agradable cerveza, no tan alcohólica ni  empalagosa. Más bien dulce, que bebida a temperatura ambiente se disfruta gratamente!

AROMA: bread, nuts, woody, 
APPEARANCE: brown, clear, frothy, white foam
TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
PALATE: full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long, bitter
OVERALL: one of the best among the Trappist.
Sampled at SMÖF 2012. Pours cloudy copper with a big white head. Smells and tastes sweet caramel malty, abit nutty.

Bottiglia da 0.75 comprata allItalmark per 6.30 .ABV 7.5.
Ambrato molto scuro, sul marrone "pulito" e non torbido.
Head abbastanza minimale.
Al naso offre ottime note di caramello, frutta esotica matura, cioccolato fondente e qualche nota di lievito.
PIuttosto dolciastra ma con retrogusto amaro abbastanza lieve, di corpo elegante e intrigante, soft carbonation, finale lungo e speziato.
Decisamente consigliata, per me è una ottima Dubbel.
,

Off white or cream coloured head and pours a pale burgundy; lacking in aromas apart from a touch of banana and toffee; tastes is overly simple, especially for a dubbel, smacks of banana with touches of marmalade, brown sugar and some very mild spice flavour, but these tastes dont come layered, theyre all just muddled together. Palate is too alcoholic and lacks any distinct flavours except for the obvious toffee flavour of most dubbels. All round, doesnt live up to the standard of many of the Belgian Trappist dubbels, but this Dutch cousin has a good crack nonetheless.

The aroma is by far the strongest thing about this beer, its beautiful, hits you rich with fruit, especially cherries, along with malt and sugar. Pours with a beige head that rapidly disappears. Some fruit on the tongue and a nice balance of malt and quite bitter hops makes this an enjoyable beer, although the taste never lives up to that magnificent aroma.

33 cl bottle, 7%. Appearance: pours a wonderful shiny ruby red, slightly hazed, with a massive offwhite to beige head, beautiful. On the nose has a fresh approach with spices and a soapy note. Aroma is delicately fruity (grapes, banana, citrus) with well-matching grainy dark malts, brown sugar, spices. Hops impact is balanced, citrusy, peppery thus not overwhelming. Taste is nicely swinging between a moderate fruity sweetness and a decise bitterness counterpart. Finish is long, aromatic, spiced, softly alcoholic, moderately dry still somewhat sticky. Body is medium, while carbonation is sustained. Overall: a very good one, appreciable complexity and fine bouquet indeed. No flaws at all, probably needs that bit more to be perfect, but still good, good, good.
(bottle) hazy amber colour with a tall brown head; aroma of caramel, dried fruit, bit medicinal; mostly sweet not overly complex flavour

330 ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy dark brown and reddish colour with a medium-sized tan head. Slightly metallic aroma with malt, raisins and sugar. Taste of malt, fruits and toffee. Medium to high carbonation, medium bodied and creamy mouthfeel. Caramel finish. Quite nice trappist but the aroma is bit too neutral.
Dark brown coloured beer with a small head. Fresh sweet (caramel), malty and chocolate aroma with an alcohol finish. Flavour is sweet (caramel), malty and chocolate. Nice beer! (Bottle 33cl)

33 cl. bottle poured in to a trappist glass. Nice, dark amber colour with ruby hues. Small, dense off-white head. Fruity aroma with dark, dried fruits, brown sugar, caramel malts, yeasts and a spicy note. Taste is sweet. Medium to full body with a creamy texture, average carbonated. Finishes sweet with spices, dark fruits and a hint of citrus. Nice Dubbel.
33cl. Dark brown-red color with nice white head. Some bitterness in it with some flavors of fruits, caramel. Good aftertaste. Very good beer

Crimson red pour. Head dissipates pretty quick. Banana, cherry funk smell. Smooth fruity taste, no bitter. A little yeast after taste but not as much as you usually get with a Belgian. Not a lot of taste overall. Good not great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2012 Brown colour with a tan head. Aroma is candi and belgian yeast. Taste is mostly banana, belgian yeast, lots of spices. Really good balance, nothing that stands too much out, its just a really nice beer!

Bottle. Dark red, brown, with sediment. A good candi/belgian esters on the nose. Malts on the palate, with a nice candi/molasses backing that the nose promised. Raisins, plums.. dark, overripe fruits (bananas comes to mind) some cloves and other spices. everything that this sort of a beer usually has. Not too hot or anything, an excellent dubbel. I must do a westmalle/la trappe dubbel/rochefort 8 comparison at some point, these seem equally awesome right now.

(bottle) Clear dark ruby with little head. Aroma has raisins and port notes. Medium bodied and fizzy. Flavour is caramel toffee developing a dark toffee bitterness. Overall a pleasant beer, but somehow it did not impress me as much as expected.
Good aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, memorable. Rated from the bottle.
Deep reddish brown pour, thick persistant head. Winey aroma, caramel and sweet. Flavour is dark caramel, some bitterness, sweet, christmas pudding. A cracker.

Fantastic dark ruby clear color with brownish faom head, lasting and lacing to glass. Aroma is sweet fruit, berries and stuff. Taste is surprisingly not too sweet (I normally find the dubbels to be too sweet), some low bittersweet. Short aftertaste, again not sweet, some barley. (Velp 201209)

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Scuro color rubino con un cappello di schiuma beige chiaro mediamente persistente. Aroma maltoso e dolciastro con sentori di frutta essicata e zucchero abbrustolito; gusto mediamente dolce e rotondo con note di caramello e un finale leggermente più amarognolo ed asciutto. Morbida al palato e di corpo medio, una buona dubbel, ma non è proprio il mio stile.

From someone who doesnt like Dubbels... Pours a deep rich brown with red notes. Aroma is sweet, malty, hazelnut, deep fruit, caramel, toffee, complex. Flavor follows, with smooth sweetness, caramel all over, darker fruit, including dates and raisins. Medium body, and lighter than I may have expected. Overall, amazing. Again, coming from someone who isnt a fan of dubbels.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2014 Aroma has fruits and herbs. Mahagony brown, hazy. Big head but quite short. Taste has dark dried fruits, herbs, alcohol is there but as warmth not burning sting, little pepper bite also. Soft, finish slightly bitter, medium body, low carbonation. Good flavors and nuanced also, lots to flavour. Good one. Retasting I find also ash in aroma, Belgian yeast, not that much herbs, more fliral and perfume-like notes.  Keeps thin foggy head long and bit lacing stays while drinking. Complex and great beer. Even with traditional finnish cabbage soup with bit huckleberry jam this beer works. And there is a lot of challenging flavors in this soup. Had to raise my points even more.

Bottle from vinmonopolet Storo enjoyed at home
Dark brown, big tanned head. Smells of caramel, dark and dried fruits, some yeast esters and malts. Medium sweet, some fruityness, some nuts, quite dry all together. Too dry for my palate. Light bitter earthy finish.Medium body, lively carbonation, watery texture. Quite a nice trappist, still the other ive tried are almost all better. This one is too dry and makes you want more taste. Still a decent beer

caramel, chocolate, citrus, earthy, banana, vanilla, woody, brown, clear, brown foam, frothy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, creamy, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

A - Dark brown with a small creamy head that thinned out quickly to remain a film for the remainder of the beer.

S - Dark fruits roasted malt and brown sugar, some sour cherry coming through as well.

T - Begins with raisins figs and dates along with some toasted malt. Then a bit of booze warms you up and finishes off with a slight coffee bitterness. Nice but overall, a lack of depth.

M&D - Pretty nice carbonization but I would have liked it a bit softer and smoother. Fizzed up a little bit in my mouth.

While a very nice beer, there are plenty of better ones that are pretty easy to get.
Almost red colour, small but persistent head. Strong fruity aroma.Taste have some fruit and caramel, still quite dry. Refreshing and balanced, a solid trappist from the Netherlands.
Yeast and fruit and slightly sour aroma. Clear with dark chunky bits.  Hints of apple cider in the flavor.
Dark ruby red. Medium tan head. Brown sugar, glace cherries, sweet malt nose. Mild fizzy carbonation, short, warming finish. Best of the La Trappes I think.

It pours mahogany with ruby highlights; the head is light-tan and foamy. The aroma has notes of: hazelnut, red-fruit jam, pumpernickel bread, and green bananas. The taste is medium sweet that finishes as such; there are notes of: red-fruit marmalade, green bananas, alcohol, dried-banana candy, and slight coffee. The palate is medium bodied, low carbonation, slightly viscous, and a medium finish. Overall, do you like bananas? Well... have I got the beer for you!

0,33l bottle. A dark red beer with a disappearing brown head. The aroma has notes of caramel, chocolate, brown sugar, malts, spices, fruits and sour cherry. The taste is bittersweet with fruity notes. A good beer.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2014 A hazy dark brown color with a big and thick head. Aroma is very malty, full of caramel and syrup, and also fruity: notes of pear, raisin and dark fruits such as plum can be noticed. Taste is really sweet but not too sweet; the balance is very well kept. Hop aroma and flavor are mild - sweet malts and dark fruits are what this beer is all about. Medium body, slightly sticky texture. Overall this is a sweet but balanced dubbel.

A-- Poured a dark cherry color. Lots of small, tight bubbles in the head and a 1 finger light brown head. Very fine champagne like bubbles on the side of the glass. Thick lacing on the side of the glass.

S-- Dark cherry, raspberry, and a bit of fig with a brandy nose. No real noticeable alcohol smell, once it warms a little bit of a melon smell and the bread smell starts to appear. 

T-- Cherry, fig and brandy are the first to pop up. The bread taste is more of a jelly toast taste. NICE. A touch of alcohol and hops at the end.

M-- Alcohol does coat the mouth at the end and lingers for a bit. Cherry and brandy stick around a lot longer. Not a lot of carbonation and not real heavy for having a brandy taste to it.

D-- Nice and easy to drink. ABV is noticeable but it is mostly once it opens up. Still easy to drink and enjoy. Nice appearance, nose, and taste. A drinkable beer that can be done any time of the year.
Bottle from Alko. Brown color, beige head. Strong, sweet taste with plum, citrus and barnyard aroma. Smooth, malty finish. Great belgian brew.
Bottle. Pours cloudy brown, many large floaties, small tan head. Aroma of caramel and yeast. Flavor of caramel, roasted malt, a bit fruity, some banana. Somewhat watery in the mouth.

Really cloudy, unappealing look.reddish brown. Smells like banana and bread.tastes like laffy taffy banana. Some coffee bitterness. Kind ofdisappointing but i can see being pleasant in certain circumstances.

Bottle. Looks dark brown in the glass, but pick it up and you see an amazing ruby shine through. Thin layer of tan foam. Smells of candy, fig, bready malts. Flavour is gentle, smooth and delicious. Quite sweet and tastes of candy, a little banana, dark fruits,  some breads. Very lively on the carbonation. Yum!
Dark red color with almost no head. Smells tropical fruits and caramel. Taste is a bit sweet and caramel with hints of fruits. Good quality dubbel.
Red-brown with white head. Caramel and fruit notes. Taste is caramel, bread, bananas, figs.
330ml bottle - Not the prettiest, a dull ruby coloured headless brew belies a rich fulsome beer. Dark fruits, raisin, cherry, vanilla, spices all coming through with a nice thick body.
Bottle. Deep reddish brown color with a foamy beige head. Sweet malty aroma with dried fruits and some alcohol. Flavor is sweet caramel malt, dried fruits and spicy yeast. Medium-body, decent dubbel.

On tap at Madrids La Mayor Cervezeria
Dark Brown with a rich creamy head
rooty, earthy aromas
Chalky mouthfeel
Sweet up front
Reminds me so much of New Belgiums dubbel, which is somewhat off putting to me because Im not a huge fane of NB dubbel

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Bottle at "Spoon and Ginger", Eindhoven. Pours copper with white head. Aroma is malt, iron, apples, anise and fennel. Taste is light bitter and medium sweet. Body is oily with lively carbonation. Finish is bitter with licorice and hints of pineapple.

33 cl bottle. BBE 09/2014.
Originally rated on 20090920. (7+3+7+3+14)
Pours hazy dark red color with a large, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, malts, yeast, ripe fruits some sugar and spices. Flavor of caramel, yeast, malts, ripe fruits, hints of spices and some earth. Some liquorice on the finish also. Medium carbonation, thick malty palate with a sweet fruity finish.
4335

330 ml bottle. Hazy reddish brown colour, thin but persistent light beige head. Aroma of toasted caramel malt, banana, spices and dried dark fruits. The flavour has the same elements, with yeasty notes. Very tasty.

33 cl, bottled. Pours cloudy red with a white wheat head. Aroma: Slightly roasted malt, coffee. Cacao. Caramel, vanilla, banana, bunch of fruit. Some grassy hoppy notes. Taste: Mildly fruity medium sweetness, some roasted bitterness. Palate: Medium body, quite soft and some carbonation. Light bitterness (roast) in aftertaste. Hints of banana. Ok, aroma-wise maybe a bit too busy for my liking.

Bottle poured at the summer Trappist tasting. Pours a darker brown color with a khaki-ish color head of foam. Nice retention. Aroma is figs and raisins predominantly, perhaps some dates and prunes as well. Taste is earthily sweet, and quite well balanced with the alcohol covered flawlessly.

Backlog june 2010 Algarve, bought at large supermarket .
DArk golden, some foam
Medium/full body & high complexity
Sweet taste and dried fruit aromas
Enjoyable

banana, caramel, barnyard, brown, hazy, frothy, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation. Lot of Belgian yeast aroma, but too sweet and unbalanced

Bellaspetto marrone chiaro con riflessi ramati, schiuma fine non molto persistente. Il naso è abbastanza intenso con sentori fruttati e biscottati. Entra in bocca abboccata, con un corpo medio e una chiusura leggermente amaricante......non male, anche se preferisco la cugina Westmalle......
33 cL bottle into a La Trappe glass at Sheffield Tap.  Very faint caramel aroma.  Light, bubblegum, caramel notes.  Pleasant summer sipper.

Che dire una dubble coi fiocchi!! Ambrata intensa con poca schiuma, ma molta frizzantezza, dolce al naso e al parlato, leggermente citrica e di un corpo. Nel mio caso servita un po? troppo fredda. ECCEZIONALE!

Keg at the House of Trembling Madness, York. Pours a slightly murky dark brown, finger of head that fades. Aroma is classic dubbel, dark fruits and malts dominating. Taste is similar, with dark fruits, Belgian esters, sweet with just the tiniest hint of the character of something four (but without the sourness - Im perfectly aware that makes no sense). Medium-full body, long finish. Mmm, this is good.

The aroma has hints of nitrogen. Head is very thick when poured but goes flat after a few minutes.  Hazy and dark brown. Wonderful burst of orange rind flavor, maybe slight hint of banana, the nitrogen almost compliments it. Close to abrupt finish. Delishious beer, would like to enjoy this one on a Friday evening. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Cheeky Monk. Poured a clear brown, with a red tint and frothy off-white head. Smell is yeast, sweet bread, light spice, biscuit, with some roastiness and light coffee. Taste is much the same, with hints of biscuit, coffee, and some light roastiness. Also, picking up some banana bread and spice, as well. Medium body with soft carbonation. A lot going on in this beer, yet highly drinakable. Good beer.

Dark brown with red colour. Aroma little bit fruit with very strong malt. Flavour is little bit sweet but not so much. Good body. Balanced alcohol, malt, sweet and good long finish.
I prefer another Trappists beers, but it is a good choice

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with reddish tinges down the side of the glass. Large light brown coloured head. Flavours are dominated by dark malt sweetness with a touch of roasted grain. Flavours are likewise dominated by malt. Only the slightest hint of acidity on the finish. Slightly watery mouthfell.
nice ruby colored dark beer, aroma has hints of dark chocolate. Has a chocolate taste as well, not a really heavy taste as well which i did expect from the smell and color. Looks can be deceiving!

Brown 33cl bottle: Best before May 2009, drank in March 2007. Poured into my Straffe Hendrik chalice glass, it looks very good. 

Dark ruby red, very slight haze from a bit of sediment that got up from the bottom of the bottle. Light brown head which started out full and half an inche thick, but fell away fairly fast to a thin covering. 

Yeast and sweet toffe aroma, with caramel and toasted malts. 

I love Trappist Dubbels, this isnt as strong in flavour compared to most, but is still good, rich and fairly sweet, yet smooth and refreashing too. 

The most watery of the trappist Dubbels by far, but still a lot better than most Abbey beer copies. 

Westmalle Dubbel knocks spots off this beer in my eyes, but it is still a very drinkable beer. This was a fairly young beer, I have one more left, I intend to age it and see what it is like in a couple of years time.
From the bottle poured a coppery/brown brew with a light brown head.Aroma is mostly malt with floral hints. Flavor is mostly malt with nearly no hop presence. Full bodied and silky mouth feel.
Bottle. Medium brown with foamy tan head. Smells peppery and pencily and grapey and mushroomy and passion fruity and brown sugary. Syrupy mouth feel with lingering sweetness. Very sweet.
Brown coloured with a thin head. Initail taste is sweet then becomes more balanced leading to slight malt taste on the palate
Gedronken bij La Trappe en een keertje thuis, zoete geur, muf, kastanje bruin/rood van kleur, crème kleurig schuim. Ijzersmaak, zoet, net iets te weinig koolzuur.

Thought it was good but a little too malty for me. Liked the quadruple much better. 

Tasting at whole foods

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle from Bierzwerg. Dark brown colour with 2 finger lasting head. Aroma chocolate. Flavour is malt, chocolate, sweet.
Reddish brown. Beige head. Malty, sweet and fruity. I wish it had more hops. Then it might be my kind of thing.

Appearance: Dark red-brown, 
Aroma: Chocolate and dark fruits (plums), chocolate, roasted malt, spiced finish. 
Taste: Sweet malty taste, moderate bitterness. 
Palate: Mid-full body, too abrupt finish.

Bottle 330 ml. Appearance: Pours red-brown with a medium beige head. Good lacing. Aroma: Strong notes of malt. Caramel, fruits and yeast. Taste: Sweet, malt, caramel and fruits. A bit watery. Overall: A good dubbel. Lots of similitudes with La Trappe Quadrupel. Almost the same  taste and aroma, but less complexity and body.

Very dark red-brown body that is clouded with some medium sized particles. The light-brown head is large but reduces to islands and a ever-lasting layer relatively quickly. Rather strong, very pleasant and quite complex sweet malty aroma. Dark dried fruits, berries like black currant, yeast, dark caramel, faint alcohol and a nice toasted touch. Deep down I swear I get some coffee notes as well. The taste is moderate sweet and moderate to light bitter. Quite strong flavours that match the sweet aroma. A very good dubbel that is both complex and drinkable, sweet and bitter.
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 1.5 years before BB date, from Vinonopolet Storo, Oslo]

UPDATED: APR 10, 2012 Bottle. Pours a dark brown-red body, with a fairly large light brown head that stays quite enough. Roasted aroma, with notes of grain, and a faint caramel aroma. Roasted malt flavour, bitter, and light sweet. Bitter finish, nice palate overall. Not the thing I was waiting for, but still nice.

A - brown sugar and yeasty
A - dark brown and frothy
T - roasted sweet with light roasted bitter
P - mid to full and soft
O - good
Draft @Bar in MaastrichtBrown colour, brown head. Aroma is candy and christmas spices. Taste sweet, toffée, see aroma. Body is a bit low.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2012 Refrigerated bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours opaque dark brown with light brown highlights and small beige head.  Lots of small bubble lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and light fig aroma.  Taste is dark malt, prune, some fig, some dark candy sugar, and some molasses.  This is good, but not as much flavor as Westmalle Dubbel.
Bottle. Amber colour with a white head. Aroma of raisin and spices. Flavour is malty with hints is spices.
30cl bottle, directly from Netherland. Sentori di malto al naso. Schiuma persistente. Tipica dubbel che lascia chiaramente apprezzare i malti hops. Buona ma non indimenticabile.

(bottle) pours a clear deep ruby-red colour with a frothy light beige head. aroma of cherries and vanilla, caramel, light treebark and slightly burnt toffee. flavour is mostly the same, though with heavy notes of bubble gum and a medium-bitter chestnut finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Sűrű hab ami piszkos szürke. Illata erősen szinte bódítóan aszalt gyömölcsös, banán és alkohol felhő. Színe sötét rubin nem teljesen tiszta. 
Édes savas közepes testességgel operál. Durva maláta túlerővel állunk szemben. Erős erjedtség. Vége kiegyenlítetten kesernyés. Nemtom  tűrhető és a még kóstolni kell kategória.
Dark brown beer with fine suspension. Sugary, very yeasty smell. Overly sweet with alcoholic back burn. Thick is not always substantial. Not quite what one expects from the style.
La Trappe Dubbel  (Berkel-Enschot, Netherlands) - Overall Score: C - Acceptable Standard

Very dark beer, with a dark brown head.  Not a lot on the nose apart from sweetness and a bit of doughy yeast.  Becomes a lot more interesting in the mouth; licorice and hops play a bitter-sweet tag around the full bready yeast.  Lingers to a long dark bitter aftertaste.  I was surprised by how nice this was, La Trappe, for me, have been a "well, if nothing better is going" brewer.  But this, their dubbel, just works well.
Buona birra si ma nulla di eccezzionale ho sentito dubbel molto migliori...

[ASPETTO] 			
color marrone scuro con riflessi porpora, piuttosto limpida			
[SCHIUMA]			
color beige, buona presenza,  media finezza e persistenza			
[ OLFATTO ]			
buona intensità: lieviti, malti tostati, caramello, zucchero. Leggero fruttato e note alcoliche			
[GUSTO]			
buona intensità, con un dolce inziale di caramello, note zuccherate, lievito. Poi procede con un fruttato non molto pronunciato per finire con un toni amari e torrefatti, a cui si aggiungono sentori alcolici			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, buona carbonazione, alcohol percettibile 			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
belgian strong dark ale tendenzialmente dolciastra con un fruttutato non preponderante e un tostado finale interessante che controbilancia il tutto. Alcolicità ben dosata. Per il resto, pulita, consistente in bocca e molto piacevole.

330 ml bottle bought @ Bierzwerg.de. Pours very dark amber with bubbly brownish white head that leaves some lacing on the glass while quickly dissipating. Smell is sweet, spicy and slightly metallic with dark bread, prunes, caramel and yeast. Taste is sweet, bitter and metallic with dark bread, banana bread, raisins, prunes, soy sauce, hazelnuts and yeasty esters. Finish is slightly sweet and rather bitter with dark bread and spices.

330 ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours clear dark brown with a big light tanned head. Aroma of aramel. Taste is the same, malty caramel and some spicy hops. Nothing complex here, but a drinkable beer anyhow.

33 cl bottle @ home. Dark ruby with a tan head. Yeasty aroma with some dark fruits (grapes, blackberries). Roasted malts in the taste and  a hint of coffee. Sweet with a pleasant bitterness. Good dubbel!
Dark brown color, nice light brown head, medium/light bitterness. I particulary like this "dubbel", because, besides the regular "dubbel"-taste, it also has a nice added sweetness that i like

Bottle. Dark brown with a medium-sized, creamy head. Aroma is banana, biscuits, caramel, yeast, blackberries, some light vinousness and soft spices. Medium body, velvety mouthfeel. Taste is sweetish, aromatic, fruity-caramelly-biscuity, with a sweet-bitter finish and an aftertaste of spices, biscuits, banana, caramel, chocolate and blackberries. Complex, soft and rich dubbel.
7.0% amber colour with a good head, sweet caramel aroma, fruity and malty taste, very good.
herbs, coffee, toast, nuts, bubblegum, smoke, soy sauce, ginger, skunky, brown, tan foam, brown foam, rocky head, amber, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, umami, full body, long finish,
Had this beer some time ago, transferring data from  database before Januar I was using to rate beer. As I drink this again I will add a complete review.

330ml bottle. Pours clear deep brown body with a yellow-brown head. Aroma of tutti-fruit, vanilla and anise. Well balanced taste of  bananas, vanilla, caramel and raisin. Mild bitterness. Lasting aftertaste.
Brown, fruity, caramel, toffee, decent carbonation, an enjoyable dubbel with a good body

Pours clear and brown with a big off white head.  Nose is caramel, spice, brown and Belgian candy sugar.  Flavor is sweet for the most part with a hint of bitter in the middle.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied, soft and creamy.
Bottle at Ivars Kro. Pours deep amber with a light brown head. Aroma of spices and raisins. Pretty sweet, not much bitterness. Some alcohol, but a pretty good dubbel.

Fruity, light nose.  Medium amber color with average head, no appreciable retention.  strong astringent alcohol dominates throughout tasting experience, a characteristic not shared with even the highest alcohol / vol belgian beers.  Crappy shit tasting finish... yuckmeister.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Nice double. Deep brown colour, tiny brown head which diminishes quickly. Aroma is sweet with some herbs. Taste is sweet malts, caramel, raisins. Medium sweet finish. Full body. Definitely a good balance between sweet flavours and malt.

A very rich flavorful beer. Starts of a bit tart with cherries and raisins, finishes very smooth and refreshing. Had it this one on draught for my first taste. Looking forward to having this in bottle to compare.
Bottle from the Bitter End Offie, Bromley. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Chocolate, raisin and dark fruit aroma. Marzipan, toffee and burnt sugar flavour. Sweet, fruity finish.

Not a shabby tasting abbey dubbel but one that I was not all too impressed with upon my tasting.  Its a good intro-brew into the Dubbels but there are fare better tasting ones on the market.  Some reminiscence of chocolate and dark fruits along with some hints of biscuit dough and lemon zest.  This brew is okay by itself but would pair up better with some cheesy pasta.

From a 330ml bottle on 21/12/2011. Pours a cloudy reddy amber with a good head. Has a subdued aroma of caramel, dark fruit, and spices. The flavour is a relatively mild combination of caramel, toffee and dark fruit, some Christmas cake, and a decent spicy bitterness at the back. Decent but not mind blowing.

bottle. dark brown, nearly red colour, medium head that quickly disappears. plum and berries in the nose, balanced fruity-sweet taste. smooth, medium-full body with a long lasting aftertaste. a current favourite.

Cloudy dark brown collor with creamy brown collar which disappears quickly after pouring. Standard brown beer smell. Taste of average brown beer, not really something special. Light sweet fruity aftertaste.

330ml bottle from Cracked Kettle

Pours brown with a small white head. Aroma has notes of raisin, caramel malts, syrup and spices. Taste is quite malty and sweet with notes of spices. Finish is slightly sweet and warming. Okay dubbel.
33cl bottle at caffe noir, braga, portugal. Nice brown color and medium to thin head. Medium carbonation and medium texture. Fruit and toast aroma. Not too sweet, which is good in this case.
Uit de fles in een cafe. Donker, aangenaam zoetig met een volle smaak. De schuimkraag was snel verdwenen.  Moet thuis nog een keer op herhaling voor een dieptetest ; )

Picked up a crock at the local off licence and it is pretty stunning to look at.   La Trappe pours a deep red, almost burgundy with a strong aroma of spice and fruit.
